name: Marco Antonio Berto
position: Diretor Conceitual da Consult Engenharia de Avalia√ßoes
text: Ainda com rela√ß√£o ao Quadro Geral de Credores - QGC - meus alunos e clientes me perguntaram mais algumas coisas (que interpretei como d√∫vidas e assim esclareci):  A Recupera√ß√£o Judicial √© um mecanismo que visa reestruturar as d√≠vidas de uma empresa em dificuldade financeira, buscando preservar sua viabilidade econ√¥mica e social. Dentro desse contexto, o quadro geral de credores desempenha um papel fundamental. Vamos explorar a import√¢ncia desse quadro:  ### 1. **Transpar√™ncia e Organiza√ß√£o** O quadro geral de credores proporciona uma vis√£o clara e organizada das d√≠vidas da empresa, listando todos os credores e os valores devidos. Essa transpar√™ncia √© essencial para que todos os envolvidos compreendam a real situa√ß√£o financeira da empresa.  ### 2. **Prioridade de Pagamentos** No processo de recupera√ß√£o, √© crucial entender a ordem de prioridade dos credores. O quadro geral ajuda a identificar quais s√£o os credores com garantias reais, os quirograf√°rios (sem garantias) e os preferenciais. Isso impacta diretamente nas estrat√©gias de negocia√ß√£o e pagamento.  ### 3. **Negocia√ß√£o e Acordos** Com um quadro bem estruturado, a empresa pode abordar os credores de forma mais eficaz, propondo acordos que sejam vi√°veis e justos. Compreender a totalidade das d√≠vidas permite que a empresa fa√ßa propostas que considerem a capacidade de pagamento e a urg√™ncia dos credores.  ### 4. **Planejamento da Recupera√ß√£o** A an√°lise do quadro geral de credores √© essencial para o planejamento da recupera√ß√£o. A empresa pode elaborar um plano que leve em conta as condi√ß√µes de cada grupo de credores, buscando solu√ß√µes que equilibrem os interesses de todos.  ### 5. **Confian√ßa no Processo** A elabora√ß√£o do quadro geral de credores pode aumentar a confian√ßa de investidores e parceiros na recupera√ß√£o da empresa. Isso √© importante para a capta√ß√£o de novos recursos, que podem ser necess√°rios para a reestrutura√ß√£o e continuidade das opera√ß√µes.  ### 6. **Acompanhamento Judicial** O quadro tamb√©m √© relevante no √¢mbito judicial. Ele serve como um documento importante para o juiz e para os advogados, facilitando a an√°lise do caso e garantindo que todos os credores sejam devidamente contemplados no processo.  ### 7. **Evitar Fraudes e Conflitos** Um quadro geral bem elaborado ajuda a evitar fraudes e conflitos entre credores. Ele assegura que todos os credores sejam tratados de maneira justa, minimizando o risco de a√ß√µes judiciais paralelas que possam atrasar ou comprometer o processo de recupera√ß√£o.  Conclus√£o  Em s√≠ntese, o quadro geral de credores √© uma ferramenta essencial para o sucesso da Recupera√ß√£o Judicial. Ele promove a transpar√™ncia, facilita a negocia√ß√£o e assegura um tratamento justo entre os credores, contribuindo para a reestrutura√ß√£o eficiente da empresa e, consequentemente, sua sobreviv√™ncia no mercado. A sua correta elabora√ß√£o e atualiza√ß√£o s√£o fundamentais para que a recupera√ß√£o seja bem-sucedida e beneficie tanto a empresa quanto seus credores.

name: Manuel L.
position: Profesional Independiente, temas cooperaci√≥n financiera /gobierno, analista pol√≠tico e internacional.
text: El discurso debe de ser la Biodiversidad, no el Cambio Clim√°tico. En mis 15 a√±os trabajando en y con proyectos del llamado "Sector Verde" que comprenden la "Biodiversidad y el Cambio Clim√°tico y el hecho de estar en el tema por m√°s de 30 a√±os de manera voluntaria, cada vez estoy m√°s convencido que la "pol√≠tica mundial" tiene el discurso equivocado, se habla de "Cambio Clim√°tico" un tema que tiene seguidores como detractores y ambos con muy buenos argumentos, donde es dif√≠cil que un parte logre convencer a la otra, m√°s a√∫n si uno no tiene los argumentos de los expertos a la mano. El "Cambio Clim√°tico" tambi√©n es discurso con fines econ√≥micos que terminan perjudicando a la Biodiversidad, que para mi es la fuente de la sostenibilidad, el Eden, la esperanza de la Humanidad. Bajo el argumento de "Cambio Clim√°tico" se motiv√≥ la energ√≠a e√≥lica que mata a millones de aves a nivel mundial, se justifican enormes instalaciones de energ√≠a fotovoltaica, que tambi√©n matan la visa silvestre y no permite la generaci√≥n de plantas, se motiva los motores el√©ctricos sin proporcionar una soluci√≥n al reciclaje de las contaminantes baterias (a la larga la mejor generaci√≥n de energ√≠a renovable son las Hidroel√©ctricas, que si bien cortan ecosistemas y al construirse causan un gran impacto, terminan protegiendo los bosques y la vida que hay en ella, pues los requieren para que continue la generaci√≥n de agua, pero han sido satanizadas pol√≠ticamente) El Cambio Clim√°tico... como todo en Occidente, termina siendo un negocio, para los que est√°n en las energ√≠as renovables es inminente, para los negacionistas el combustible f√≥sil sigue siendo la mejor opci√≥n....Pero si enfatizamos la Biodiversidad y hacemos conciencia respecto a algo que si se est√° perdiendo, como la recarga h√≠drica, la p√©rdida de vida silvestre, de insectos, animales y su h√°bitat... el Cambio Clim√°tico estar√° cubierto de caj√≥n.

Location: Yamagata, Japan Job Type: Full-time Are you passionate about culinary excellence and seeking a unique opportunity to showcase your skills amidst breathtaking mountain scenery? Join our team as a Chef at a renowned ski lodge in Yamagata, Japan, where you'll have the chance to create unforgettable dining experiences for our guests. We are looking for a talented and experienced Chef to lead our restaurant kitchen and deliver exceptional cuisine that complements our guests' fantastic adventures on the slopes.  Responsibilities: ‚Ä¢ Oversee all aspects of the kitchen operations, ensuring the highest level of food quality, presentation, and taste. ‚Ä¢ Create innovative and seasonally inspired menus that cater to a diverse clientele. ‚Ä¢ Train, supervise, and motivate a team of kitchen staff to maintain a smooth and efficient operation. ‚Ä¢ Monitor and manage food costs, inventory, and supplies, ensuring optimal utilisation and minimising waste. ‚Ä¢ Collaborate with management to develop new concepts and ideas for special events and themed dining experiences. ‚Ä¢ Maintain a safe and sanitary work environment, following all food safety and hygiene standards. ‚Ä¢ Continuously strive for excellence, staying up to date with culinary trends and techniques.  Requirements: ‚Ä¢ Previous experience working as a Chef in a high-volume restaurant or hotel environment. ‚Ä¢ Profound knowledge of Japanese cuisine, including traditional and regional dishes. ‚Ä¢ Ability to create visually appealing presentations that are as pleasing to the eye as they are to the palate. ‚Ä¢ Strong leadership and communication skills to effectively manage and inspire a team. ‚Ä¢ Excellent organisational and time management abilities, with the capacity to multitask and prioritise. ‚Ä¢ Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as per the demands of the ski lodge industry. ‚Ä¢ Fluency in English and Japanese, enabling effective communication with guests and staff.  Benefits: ‚Ä¢ Competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications. ‚Ä¢ Accommodation within the ski lodge premises. ‚Ä¢ Opportunities for professional development and training. ‚Ä¢ Immersive cultural experience in the beautiful surroundings  To Apply: If you are excited about working in a dynamic ski lodge environment and delivering extraordinary culinary experiences, we would like to hear from you. text: A Necessidade de ESG para as Organiza√ß√µes  O ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) vai al√©m de uma tend√™ncia corporativa; √© um sistema de gest√£o que integra lucro com responsabilidades ambientais, sociais e √©ticas. No Brasil, onde quest√µes como desmatamento, desigualdade social e governan√ßa fragilizada s√£o desafios constantes, o ESG se torna indispens√°vel para garantir a sustentabilidade das empresas e promover impacto positivo na sociedade. Empresas como o Grupo Balbo, a Refinaria de Petr√≥leo Riograndense e a Refinaria de Mataripe demonstram como incorporar ESG pode transformar desafios em oportunidades. As dimens√µes ambiental, social e de governan√ßa impactam as organiza√ß√µes brasileiras, apresentando exemplos pr√°ticos e avaliando os benef√≠cios dessa abordagem.  A gest√£o ambiental √© essencial para reduzir os impactos negativos das opera√ß√µes empresariais no meio ambiente. As usinas S√£o Francisco e Santo Ant√¥nio, s√£o refer√™ncia em pr√°ticas agr√≠colas sustent√°veis, utilizando controle biol√≥gico de pragas para minimizar o uso de pesticidas qu√≠micos. Al√©m disso, o Projeto Cana Verde, lan√ßado em 1987, promoveu pr√°ticas como plantio direto e elimina√ß√£o da queima na colheita, contribuindo para a preserva√ß√£o da biodiversidade. A Refinaria de Mataripe, operada pela Acelen, desenvolve uma biorrefinaria com investimento de US$ 3 bilh√µes para produzir biocombust√≠veis, como diesel verde e combust√≠vel sustent√°vel de avia√ß√£o. Utilizando √≥leo de maca√∫ba como mat√©ria-prima, a iniciativa prev√™ opera√ß√µes at√© 2027, integrando energia renov√°vel e cultivo sustent√°vel. Outro exemplo significativo √© a Refinaria de Petr√≥leo Riograndense, que processou 100% de √≥leo de soja, liderando o refino renov√°vel. Essas a√ß√µes refor√ßam a viabilidade de pr√°ticas sustent√°veis como estrat√©gia competitiva.  O ESG social visa promover impacto positivo nas comunidades e na for√ßa de trabalho. O Grupo Balbo apoia pequenos agricultores, gerando estabilidade econ√¥mica nas regi√µes onde atua, al√©m de oferecer programas de qualifica√ß√£o para comunidades rurais, reduzindo o desemprego. J√° a Refinaria de Mataripe promove inclus√£o, priorizando a contrata√ß√£o de mulheres e pessoas em vulnerabilidade social, mostrando que equidade e diversidade geram engajamento e resultados positivos.  A governan√ßa √© fundamental para que compromissos ambientais e sociais sejam cumpridos de forma √©tica e transparente. A Refinaria de Mataripe estabelece pr√°ticas robustas de governan√ßa e sustentabilidade financeira, enquanto a Refinaria de Petr√≥leo Riograndense realiza auditorias independentes, garantindo conformidade e confian√ßa dos stakeholders. Essas pr√°ticas fortalecem a resili√™ncia empresarial em tempos de crise.  O ESG √© indispens√°vel para empresas que buscam prosperar em um mercado consciente e competitivo. Exemplos das empresas citadas, mostram que alinhar crescimento econ√¥mico, impacto social e preserva√ß√£o ambiental √© poss√≠vel e necess√°rio para liderar o futuro sustent√°vel.

position: Championing Financial Inclusion Through Disruptive Innovation
text: Visa‚Äôs new collaboration with QR payment providers across Asia Pacific aims to make cross-border payments more convenient and secure for consumers.  For businesses, this approach has the potential to expand customer reach and reduce payment processing costs, especially for small and medium-sized enterprises. With lower fees than traditional card payments, QR integration allows businesses to attract international customers and promotes the adoption of cashless transactions in a straightforward, accessible way, potentially transforming the Asia Pacific payments ecosystem into a more connected and interoperable network.

name: MightyID Communication Inc
text: üì¢ Due Diligence and Peer Review - Key Steps to Ensuring Quality for Start-up Visa Canada Projects! In the journey of starting a business in Canada, ensuring transparency and quality in your project is crucial. This is why Due Diligence and Peer Review are considered two essential processes that help investors and regulatory authorities thoroughly evaluate the feasibility and potential of your project. However, with recent changes, entrepreneurs must stay updated to better prepare for participation in the Start-up Visa program. üöÄ Due Diligence - Comprehensive Assessment Before Investment Decisions Are you ready to answer questions about your finances, legal framework, and business model? Due Diligence is a process that helps investors examine and evaluate every detail before committing to your project. Transparency and risk control are critical factors for a project to succeed. This is a step that every start-up must undergo to demonstrate solid preparation and growth potential. üíº Peer Review - Enhancing Project Credibility Through Independent Evaluation Previously, Peer Review was an independent evaluation step to confirm that your project is valuable and trustworthy. Experts would assess the quality, innovation, and economic potential of the project, ensuring that supporting organizations back only projects that contribute meaningfully to Canada‚Äôs economy. However, as of August 1, 2024, Peer Review has been suspended‚Äîno new requests are being accepted, and all ongoing processes have been canceled. ‚ö†Ô∏è What Does the Suspension of Peer Review Mean? Peer Review once acted as a "shield" to protect start-ups against fraud, ensuring that entrepreneurs and supporting organizations adhered to industry standards. Its suspension marks a significant shift, with IRCC officers now directly evaluating and questioning projects instead of relying on an independent expert panel. üìå New Challenges Without Peer Review Without Peer Review, IRCC officers will make quicker decisions, leaving businesses with limited time to prepare. This means entrepreneurs must prepare their applications more thoroughly and clearly than ever before. You need to ensure that all information about your finances, business plan, and project operations is ready to convince IRCC officers from the outset. ‚ú® Tips for Success: Prepare detailed and comprehensive documentation, from finances to business plans, to increase your chances of success in the Start-up Visa application process. Ensure you have sufficient documents and evidence to substantiate your project without relying on the Peer Review timeline. üí¨ Questions about the Due Diligence process or recent changes to the Start-up Visa program? Leave a comment or message us. Our team is ready to support and answer all your questions to help you prepare for your start-up journey in Canada!  Hotline: 078-555-2875 Website: Email: Address: 64 Truong Dinh, Vo Thi Sau Ward, District 3

We are actively looking for the below position for  hashtag #Sydney Australia  Job Title: Performance Engineer/Performance Testing Job Type : Contract Work Type: Hybrid Job Duration: 6 Months+ Job Location: Sydney ,Australia   Note- Candidates with valid work Visa can eligible to apply ,no visa sponsorship or transfer is allowed  Job Requirment :  1. name: Â§ßÂ∂ãÂÆπÂ∏Ç
text: Tax Revenue Enhancement Strategies and the Japan New Deal Plan  Overview  The tax revenue enhancement strategies are based on the Japan New Deal Plan, aimed at economic recovery and sustainable growth. This plan involves national investment and structural reforms to increase tax revenue in both the short and long term, while strengthening Japan‚Äôs global competitiveness.   ---  Strategy 1: Institutionalizing Medical Tourism  Description: Leverage Japan's advanced medical technologies to establish medical tourism. Promote the international certification of acupuncture, osteopathy, massage, and other medical practices to attract foreign patients.  Goal: Increase tax revenue by promoting medical tourism.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Position medical tourism as a national strategy, investing in infrastructure and promoting international standardization.   Strategy 2: International Certification of Cultural Resources  Description: Promote the international certification of Japanese cultural assets such as bonsai, Japanese gardens, acupuncture, massage, and osteopathy, offering foreigners the opportunity to obtain these qualifications.  Goal: Increase tax revenue by gaining international recognition for Japan's unique cultural practices and techniques.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Develop a global strategy to promote Japanese culture and implement international marketing and qualification programs.   Strategy 3: Introduction of Medical Tourism Visas  Description: Establish a new short-term medical tourism visa to simplify the process for foreign patients seeking medical services.  Goal: Expand the medical tourism market and increase tax revenue.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Integrate medical tourism into the national strategy and support visa system reform.   Strategy 4: Standardization of Domestic Events  Description: Standardize domestic cultural events and tourism festivals to streamline promotions, and develop new tourist routes using regional resources.  Goal: Stimulate regional tourism and increase tourism tax revenue.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Support regional revitalization through event standardization and the development of tourism infrastructure.   Strategy 5: Establishment of Special Zones and Regulatory Relaxation  Description: Designate specific regions as special zones for medical and cultural tourism, relaxing regulations to attract foreign investors.  Goal: Promote regional economic growth and increase tax revenue.  Relation to the Japan New Deal Plan: Support the establishment of special zones and invest in regulatory reform and infrastructure development.

name: Hong Soon Chin
position: Doctor of Philosophy/ Chief Operating Officer
text: Building on the previous post:  The extensive AMR bacterial collection available in our store is as follows:  Klebsiella pneumoniae subsp. pneumoniae (ESBL positive) ATCC 700603 A Gram-negative bacterium found in the normal flora of the mouth, skin, and intestines. It can cause destructive changes to human and animal lungs if aspirated (inhaled), specifically to the alveoli (in the lungs) resulting in bloody sputum (mixture of saliva and mucus).  Klebsiella pneumoniae, carbapenem-resistant NCTC 13438 Gram-negative bacteria are found in the normal flora of the mouth, skin, and intestines. Causes bloody sputum (a mixture of saliva and mucus) if inhaled by humans and animals. Often resistant to multiple antibiotics and now carbapenem  Neisseria gonorrhoeae, penicillin-resistant ATCC 49981 Gram-negative bacteria. Of the 11 species, only 2 are pathogenic. Causes gonorrhoea (sexually transmitted infection) and is transmitted through sexual contact.  Neisseria gonorrhoeae, cephalosporin-resistant CDC SPL-4 Gram-negative bacteria that cause infection of the genitals, throat, and eyes. Resistant to penicillin. The current treatment is with cephalosporin. Efforts to develop a vaccine are underway.  Pseudomonas aeruginosa, multidrug-resistant ATCC BAA-2108 Gram-negative bacteria that cause pneumonia (acute bronchus inflammation), bloodstream infections, surgical site infections and urinary tract infections. Carbapenem is the 'last line of defence against gram-negative bacteria but is increasingly ineffective against P. aeruginosa.  Staphylococcus aureus subsp. aureus, methicillin-resistant; reduced vancomycin susceptibility ATCC 700699 MRSA with reduced Vancomycin susceptibility (VISA) has been reported in several countries. VISA isolates are rare, but some strains have been discovered to have a subpopulation of resistant cells (heterogeneous VISA- hVISA).  Staphylococcus epidermidis, methicillin-resistant ATCC 51625 An antimicrobial-resistant variant of S. epidermidis. Causes infection in those with catheters or surgical implants as the pathogen forms biofilms that grow on these devices.  Streptococcus pneumoniae, low level penicillin-resistant ATCC 49619 Gram-positive bacteria are a clone of S. pneumoniae emerging from Switzerland. Leading cause of potentially life-threatening community-acquired diseases.  Streptococcus pneumoniae, penicillin-resistant ATCC 700903 The most common cause of community-acquired respiratory-tract infection, causing meningitis (inflammation of the area surrounding the brain and spinal cord) and otitis media (the middle ear inflammation). Many isolates develop multidrug-resistant species (MDRSP) causing huge problems in healthcare facilities.  Please contact Viroxy for disinfectant efficacy testing using these AMR bacteria. We also welcome commercial or research collaborations focused on AMR bacterial studies.

name: Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih
position: International Relations and SDGs Enthusiast | Researcher | Analyst | Executive Assistant | Instagaram Influencer and Content Creator
text: Celebrating 75 Years of Friendship Between the United States and Indonesia!   Photo 1 : H.E. Mr. Ambassador Sung Y. Kim, U.S. Ambassador to the Republic of Indonesia and Miss Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih  H.E. Sung Y. Kim became the U.S. Ambassador to the Republic of Indonesia for the period 2020-2023. Ambassador Kim departed Indonesia on November 20 , 2023 after a successful and memorable three years in the country.  His Excellency remarkable duties in Indonesia during the period of 2020-2023: - Delivered covid vaccines to tens of millions of Indonesians. - Issued more than 100,000 visas in the past year (2023). - Hosted the U.S. President visit to Indonesia during the 2022 G20 Summit in Bali. - Hosted the Vice President visit to Indonesia during the 2023 ASEAN Summit in Jakarta. - Hosted the U.S. Secretary of State four times to Indonesia. - Elevating the partnership to a comprehensive strategic partnership between Indonesia and the U.S. in the areas of economy, education, environment, security, and defense.  Photo 2 : H.E. Mr. Jeffery P. Cohen (Pak Jeff), USAID Indonesia Misssion Director and Miss Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih  H.E. Jeffery (Jeff) P. Cohen is a Senior Foreign Service Officer with the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID). While sharing his works on USAID Indonesia's social media, Mr. Cohen humbly known as Pak Jeff with the popular hashtag   U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) has partnered with Indonesia for decades to protect the environment, build infrastructure, and strengthen health system and economy. With an annual program budget of about $100 million, USAID carries out programs in democratic governance, anti-corruption, climate and the environment, economic growth, education, and health. USAID also respond to public health and humanitarian crises, including the COVID-19 pandemic with main partners include the national and local governments, local leaders, the private sector, civil society, and donors.  Photo 3 : Mr. Jeremy Hinch, Editor & Communications Specialist at USAID Indonesia and Miss Fina Dwi Rahmadaningsih    @usembassyjkt @indonesiaindc @statedept @kemlu_ri

text: The Philippines: A Booming Travel Destination & How TransferMate Can Help OTAs Thrive! Let TransferMate be your partner in navigating the exciting world of Philippine tourism!

name: Ziyan Teo Âº†Â≠êÂΩ¶
position: Regional Lead, Fintech Account Management, Visa Direct, Asia Pacific at Visa
text: üåü Meeting Top Creators at First-Ever GenVisa Creator Summit in Tokyo! üåü  I had the privilege of attending the inaugural GenVisa Creator Summit, organized by Bytedance and Visa, in the vibrant city of Tokyo. This one-of-a-kind event brought together 50 talented and incredible creators from around Asia Pacific!  Representing Visa Direct, I had the opportunity to speak a little on how our solutions empower creators to access their earnings anytime, anywhere. From influencers to freelancers, we‚Äôre redefining how digital/creator economy moves money with speed, convenience, security, and scale.  In conversations with creators, I heard how much they value quicker access to their earnings, enabling them to reinvest in their next project or grow their audience. Some shared exciting plans to expand into small businesses‚Äîfrom launching merchandise to offering workshops‚Äîand highlighted the need for reliable payment solutions to support this transition.  What made this summit truly unforgettable was stepping into the creators' world. I got to shadow TheWeeblings, a dynamic TikTok duo specializing in personal finance content, as they crafted engaging content behind the scenes. It was inspiring to see their creativity in action and understand the nuances of content creation‚Äîan industry that thrives on quick, seamless access to earnings. I even got to be a stand-in camera man for a few minutes!  Thank youfor having me at your amazing event!  üöÄ A Call to Action: Are you a content creator platform or a gig economy enabler looking to support your creators and freelancers with fast, reliable cross-border payouts at competitive rates? Let‚Äôs connect! I‚Äôd love to explore how Visa Direct can help you drive growth and empower your community.

name: Kalyan Ramraju
position: Business Development Manager at SREE AMBICA STATIONERS
text: Hi we are Hiring for " SAP BASIS S/4 HANA Systems Administrator & Maintenance SAP Environment Consultant " Location : Singapore Duration : Contract to Hire / One year renewal Contract. Visa Type : Singaporean/ P.R/ ( As EP Quota not available ) Resource must be in Singapore. Notice period : 30 Days.  Key Responsibilities :  Administer and maintain SAP environments, including SAP ECC, S/4HANA, BW/4HANA, Solution Manager, Portal and SAP HANA databases, oracle database and Maxdb. Perform installation, configuration, and upgrades of SAP systems (e.g., ECC, S/4HANA, BW, PI/PO, etc.). Manage user accounts, roles, and authorizations within SAP systems. Monitor system performance and perform proactive tuning to ensure optimal system availability and responsiveness. Execute SAP transport management, client administration, and system refresh activities. Apply SAP system patches and kernel updates in coordination with the application and development teams. Maintain and optimize HANA database environments, ensuring data integrity and performance optimization. Monitor and ensure the security of the SAP landscape, including system audits, patch management, and compliance checks. Troubleshoot SAP-related issues and provide solutions to users and technical teams as needed. Develop and maintain documentation for system configurations, processes, and procedures. Work closely with infrastructure, networking, and security teams to align SAP system requirements with organizational IT standards. Ensure business continuity by managing backups, disaster recovery plans, and high availability strategies for SAP systems.  Requirements  5+ years of experience in SAP Basis administration, including expertise in HANA database administration is mandatory. Experience with SAP system installations, configurations, upgrades, and patch management. Hands-on experience with HANA database administration (e.g., backups, monitoring, tuning). SAP Basis or HANA certification. Knowledge of SAP security best practices and experience in SAP security audits. if above skills match with your profile, kindly send your updated resume ASAP. Current company : CTC : Ex CTC : Notice period : Visa Type :

name: Arnela Tolic
position: Lawyer (Immigration/Employment Law)| Accredited NMAS Mediator| CPD Lecturer| Business Coach üë©‚Äçüè´
text: Understanding the Subclass 186 Visa and Sponsoring an Accountant: The Caveats  The Subclass 186 visa allows Australian businesses to nominate skilled workers to fill roles that cannot be sourced locally.  It has three streams: Temporary Residence Transition (TRT) Stream ‚Äì For workers who have held a Temporary Skill Shortage (Subclass 482) visa for at least three years. Direct Entry (DE) Stream ‚Äì For workers who meet the skills assessment and work experience requirements.  Labour Agreement Stream ‚Äì For employers operating under a labour agreement with the Australian Government. For accountants, the DE and TRT streams are the most commonly used.  Accountants are on the Medium and Long-term Strategic Skills List (MLTSSL), making them eligible for the Subclass 186 visa. However, caveats apply to ensure the role meets genuine labour market needs.  Key Caveats- A must to meet  The sponsoring business must not have an annual turnover of less than AUD 1 million.  The business must employ at least five full-time employees (excluding family members).  The position is a clerical, bookkeeper or accounting clerk position.  Genuine Position Requirement The position must align with the needs of the business and not be created solely to facilitate a visa application. Employers must provide evidence such as organizational charts, financial reports, or proof of current staffing shortages to substantiate this.   Salary Thresholds The nominated accountant must be paid at least the Annual Market Salary Rate (AMSR) to ensure the role aligns with Australian employment standards.  Meeting the Skills and Qualifications Criteria The nominated accountant must: Hold qualifications equivalent to an Australian bachelor‚Äôs degree in accounting. Provide a skills assessment from a recognized authority, such as CPA Australia, Chartered Accountants Australia and New Zealand (CA ANZ), or the Institute of Public Accountants (IPA).  Have a minimum of three years of post-qualification experience for the DE stream.  Common Challenges for Employers Proving Genuine Need Employers often struggle to demonstrate that hiring an overseas accountant is essential. A robust business case with data and documentation can mitigate this risk.  Navigating Caveats Businesses with fewer than five full-time employees or turnover under AUD 1 million may face additional scrutiny. Engaging migration professionals early can help navigate these challenges.  Tips for a Successful Nomination Plan Ahead: Understand the visa requirements and align them with your hiring strategy.  Engage Experts: Seek advice from migration agents or lawyers experienced in Subclass 186 visa nominations. Maintain Compliance: Ensure your business meets all regulatory and salary obligations.  Document Thoroughly: Prepare strong evidence to support your application, including detailed job descriptions, financial reports, and organizational structures.

name: Tyrece Huff, M.S., SHRM-SCP¬Æ
position: Clinical Healthcare Recruiting Expert | High-Volume Hiring Specialist | Candidate Lifecycle Manager | A/B Testing Strategist | Data-Driven Talent Connector
text: ‚ú® Unlocking Talent Pools: Redefining Healthcare Leadership üè•  Attracting and retaining top talent in healthcare requires bold, strategic leadership. The future lies in leveraging diverse talent pools‚Äîlocally and globally‚Äîto build resilient, innovative teams that meet today‚Äôs demands and prepare for tomorrow‚Äôs challenges.  ‚úÖ Top Strategies to Unlock Healthcare Talent Pools:  üåü Empower Local Communities: Invest in upskilling underserved regions through training programs, creating sustainable pipelines of healthcare professionals.  üåü Global Talent Pipelines: Attract international talent with competitive incentives, visa support, and professional growth opportunities to diversify your workforce.  üåü AI-Driven Recruitment: Use cutting-edge technology to identify hidden talent, streamline hiring, and predict workforce needs for a smarter, faster approach.  üåü Strategic Partnerships: Collaborate with universities and training centers to align education with industry demands, ensuring job-ready professionals.  üåü Telehealth Opportunities: Break geographic barriers by offering remote roles, attracting talent seeking flexible and innovative work environments.  üè• Why It Matters:  Expanding and diversifying talent pools isn‚Äôt just a solution‚Äîit‚Äôs a leadership imperative. Addressing workforce shortages, improving inclusivity, and future-proofing healthcare teams will define success. Leaders who connect local impact with global reach will shape a more equitable, sustainable, and high-performing healthcare system.  üí° What‚Äôs Your Approach?  How are you expanding your talent pools to meet the evolving demands of healthcare? Let‚Äôs discuss! üëá

name: Alvaro Jesus Silvestre Zavala
position: Student at The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley
text: üéâ An Unforgettable Experience at SHPE üéâ  Almost a month ago, I had the incredible opportunity to attend the SHPE National Convention, and I‚Äôm still reflecting on the lessons learned and the amazing connections made.  I‚Äôve always had a passion for creating content and storytelling through videos, but engineering holds a special place in my heart because of the structure and critical thinking it brings to my life. I love the methodical approach that engineering teaches, from automating processes to understanding how systems work. Exploring manufacturing techniques, diving into programming languages, and applying mathematical principles to develop analytical skills excites me deeply. These passions are why I chose Mechanical Engineering.  As an international student, and sophomore in this field, the workload can sometimes feel overwhelming. However, attending the SHPE convention reminded me why I chose this path and reinforced my motivation.  üåü It helped me overcome fears about internships and job opportunities.  ü§ù I connected with other international students navigating their careers through visas or sponsorships, which was incredibly inspiring.  üåé Meeting people from diverse backgrounds and hearing their stories gave me the confidence to keep pushing forward.  This experience reminded me that I‚Äôm not alone on this journey and that every challenge is an opportunity to grow. I‚Äôm ready to apply everything I‚Äôve learned and continue building my future in engineering and STEM.  A huge thank-you to everyone who made this event so impactful! üöÄ

name: Aurelia Legal Pty Ltd
text: Every week, countless women worldwide endure the devastating consequences of gender-based violence.  As of 2024, this global crisis persists, with millions of lives impacted. On this International Day for the Elimination of Violence Against Women, we stand in solidarity with survivors and honor the lives tragically lost.  Today marks the beginning of 16 days of activism to end violence against women and girls. Together, we advocate for urgent reforms‚Äîstronger protections, increased funding for support services, and widespread education to foster behavioral change.  Aurelia Legal stands against all forms of family and domestic violence. If you are on a dependent visa and suffering violence, contact us today for confidential support and legal assistance.  üìû Phone: (03) 9125 8820 üìß Email: üåê Website:  If you or someone you know is in danger, help is available. Call 1800 RESPECT (1800 737 732) or Lifeline (13 11 14) for confidential, 24/7 assistance.  Let‚Äôs work toward a future where no woman lives in fear.

name: Allhouse.co.nz
text: üåü From Ancient History to Allhouse Hustler    Hi, I‚Äôm Olly üëã and here‚Äôs my story.  After graduating from the University of Liverpool with a degree in History and Ancient History (yep, the classics üè∫), I wasn‚Äôt exactly sure what I wanted to do.  But I knew one thing‚ÄîI love people and storytelling, so sales and marketing felt like a solid direction.  Fast forward a bit, and there I was, flying 22 hours from Scotland to New Zealand, ready to take on the unknown. What could possibly go wrong, right?  Turns out, I landed at Allhouse, where the vibe was very much sink or swim.  Day 1? I was handed a pile of scripts and told to go for it. No experience, no clue‚Äîjust a room, a phone, and a whole lot of hope. üòÖ  Fast forward six months, and let me tell you, it‚Äôs been a ride: ‚úÖ I‚Äôve gone from no experience to crushing cold calls. ‚úÖ I‚Äôve built some unreal client relationships. ‚úÖ I‚Äôve discovered skills I didn‚Äôt know I had (and yes, talking non-stop is one of them).  Allhouse has given me the space to grow, fail, and try again, and honestly, I wouldn‚Äôt trade it for anything. The ‚Äúwork hard, play hard‚Äù culture here has made every day an adventure.  Oh, and the big news? My internship just turned into a permanent gig, and I‚Äôve extended my visa to stick around.  So if you‚Äôre in property management or the rental market, expect to hear from me‚ÄîI‚Äôm here to help and probably share a few stories along the way.  Here‚Äôs to taking chances and chasing what‚Äôs next! üöÄ

name: Sher-li Torrey
position: Founder, Mums@Work (Singapore) | Co-Founder, Career Navigators SG | Project-Creator, Singapore:40-over-40 | LinkedIn Top Voices in Gender Equity | Founder, Return-to-Work Japan
text: It all started when Toyin O. reached out to ask if Deborah Yuen & I would be open to supporting a back-to-work event in Tokyo, Japan. We were and so it happened! Last Friday, we partnered Visa to run ‚ÄúReturn to Work Japan Symposium‚Äù, welcoming 50 ladies in Tokyo, who had taken a break / detoured career path due to caring for their families. With the support of Visa andJapan, the event featured a panel sharing, group coaching and networking with employers from ,,,,,&, together with  I am a firm believer that women empowerment is not about telling woman to be brave and speak up. Strength comes from within and from receiving positive affirmation from others. Most of all strength comes from knowing you are not alone.  From the get-go, the opening address by, sponsor of Inclusion & diversity in Visa Japan set the tone for the session. His candid story of a friend who had returned to work, embracing a different career, after more than a decade looking after family - inspired the women in the audience.  The awesome panelists in the panel session (,,,,) shared authentically about their own experience as a working mum and also from the HR perspective. As an attendee tearfully shared with us- "I am so moved by their open sharing. It makes me realise that as mothers, we are all struggling to integrate work and family, regardless of our background, experience or even our job rank at work. We are all human. "  LinkedIn‚Äôs 15 coaches volunteered to give small groups career guidance to the ladies. Having&share specific ways they got back to work, andtalk about how LinkedIn is used - was a great way to introduce personal branding. This segment saw the ladies come alive as everyone shared their experiences, challenges and solutions on moving forward.  Much gratitude to all the employer reps who came forward readily to support the ladies at the Networking Session - through your advice, sharing and guidance provided to the ladies.  Super thankful to Kyoko,,, and the entire VISA Japan team for putting in so much work to bring this project to fruition. We are excited for the many female attendees who came for the session - and looking forward to even more female empowering events in Japan soon. name: Gustavo Farfan O'Brien
position: Managing Director @ Vanguard International Systems | Decentralized Digital Asset Tokenization Software (SaaS).
text: Global Debit Card Issuance Benefits to Clients and Platform Members  Our Platforms integrates global brand debit card issuance to our clients and platform members. Offering digital and physical debit cards to redeem their DGT's gives them the ability to make payments and withdraw money from ATM's anywhere in world. This brings several significant advantages, further enhancing the utility and appeal of these tokens:  Enhanced Accessibility  ‚Ä¢ Immediate Spending Power: Members can directly convert their digital gold tokens into fiat currency and use them for daily transactions, just like any regular debit card. ‚Ä¢ Global Acceptance: These debit cards are often linked to major payment networks (e.g., Visa or Mastercard), allowing users to pay at millions of merchants worldwide.  Seamless Integration with Digital Gold  ‚Ä¢ Real-Time Conversion: Users can liquidate digital gold holdings instantly for payments, offering unparalleled liquidity compared to traditional gold investments. ‚Ä¢ Multi-Currency Support: Members can pay in local currencies while the platforms automatically convert the equivalent value from their digital gold balance.  Financial Inclusion  ‚Ä¢ Access for the Unbanked: Individuals in regions with limited banking infrastructure can use these cards to participate in global commerce, bridging the gap between digital assets and traditional financial systems. ‚Ä¢ Empowering Cross-Border Users: Global debit cards eliminate the need for expensive international wire transfers, benefiting users who rely on cross-border payments or remittances.  Increased Platform Engagement  ‚Ä¢ Customer Retention: Providing a debit card strengthens loyalty, as users are more likely to engage with the platforms for both investment and everyday spending. ‚Ä¢ Enhanced Convenience: Members benefit from a single platform that manages investments, payments, and transactions, reducing the need to switch between services.  Competitive Advantage  ‚Ä¢ Differentiation in the Market: Our Platforms offer global debit cards gaining a competitive edge by seamlessly integrating digital gold with everyday financial tools. ‚Ä¢ Brand Recognition: Issuing branded debit cards can strengthen our client platform‚Äôs reputation and visibility in global markets.  By issuing global debit cards, our digital gold platforms bridge the gap between traditional financial systems and modern digital assets, making their services more user-friendly, inclusive, and practical for a wide range of consumers. This functionality not only increases adoption but also positions our platforms as leaders in the evolving financial ecosystem.

name: Cabinhas Leitores
text: Nos √∫ltimos dois dias o Cabinhas Leitores pode participar da Expo Favela Cear√° 2024. Foi um momento potencialmente oportuno para expormos como a periferia pulsa para al√©m do empreendedorismo convencional (que visa o lucro), no nosso caso, o empreendedorismo social. No entanto, os reveses de nossa presen√ßa foram de v√°rias ordens.  Pudemos perceber, logo no primeiro dia, como os expositores selecionados tinham de o ser "favelados atuais", ou seja, se voc√™ fosse um caso de um ex-favelado que ascendeu socialmente (e, inclusive economicamente) contra todas as hip√≥teses e estat√≠sticas, voc√™ n√£o deveria l√° estar, que dir√° ser reconhecido pelo seu enraizamento e compromisso pela comunidade que te criou. Contudo, n√£o se engane, o palco (inclusive em seu sentido literal) da Expo n√£o o era para os tais "favelados atuais" (basta ver o rol de celebridades e autoridades escaladas para o evento).  Nossa localiza√ß√£o no pavilh√£o desfavoreceu, sem qualquer pingo de d√∫vida, o afluxo de pessoas para o nosso stand, o qual era voltado para a parede, de costas para o espa√ßo central e longe do palco principal.  Dos nossos dois vizinhos de stand, um deles n√£o compareceu em nenhum dia de Expo e o outro n√£o s√≥ compareceu, mas foi de um companheirismo gigante, inesperado e bem-humorado: valeu!  Agradecemos a todos que se dispuseram a andar ao rinc√£o do pavilh√£o para nos ceder sua aten√ß√£o para compreender um pouco do nosso projeto social. Foram poucas mas valorosas visitas.  Igualmente agradecemos a prestatividade da produtora local, Lara, e da gestora da Escola de Neg√≥cios da Favela, Bruna nos dias que antecederam a pr√≥pria Expo.  Alguns de nossos cabinhas vieram √† Expo visitar nosso stand e curtirem a feira como um todo. Nesse quesito, a taxa de contentamento da garotada foi bastante positiva, muito da Expo lhes foram novidades excitantes.  Em tempo, o Z√© Maria, pilar fundamental do Cabinhas Leitores, mora desde 1969 na comunidade do Padre Andrade.  PS: falar em "favela" √© tabu, pois pessoas em diferentes graus de vulnerabilidade econ√¥mica e social n√£o se enxergam como favelados, dada toda a carga demerit√≥ria da palavra.  [T.T.] [24.11.2024]

name: Regional Universities Network
text: The Regional Universities Network (RUN) in partnership with the Australian Technology Network of Universities (ATN Universities) and Innovative Research Universities (IRU) have issued a joint statement urging politicians to implement a principles-based solution to Australia‚Äôs international student visa processing problem.  Representing nearly twenty institutions, educating 120,000 onshore international students and nearly half a million domestic students, we: 1) strongly encourage Parliament to consider the remaining components of the ESOS Amendment Bill which focus on enhancing quality and integrity in the system, 2) take immediate action to address the current distorted system for visa processing, and 3) call for an open and collaborative partnership between all universities and government to develop a shared long-term strategy for international education.  We call for a student visa processing regime that is based on the principles of transparency, repeatability, and institutional equality ‚Äì ensuring that student visas are processed in the same manner for all public universities.  The shortcomings of the current visa processing regime are well known and both universities and students need transparency and equality in the processing of student visas.  Read the full statement here:

name: Agnello Neto
text: Solu√ß√µes Digitais para Log√≠stica - O que √© YMS?  O Yard Management System (YMS) √© uma solu√ß√£o digital que visa melhorar a efici√™ncia operacional na movimenta√ß√£o e no gerenciamento de ve√≠culos e cargas em √°reas de p√°tio de uma empresa, como centros de distribui√ß√£o e armaz√©ns. Ele auxilia na organiza√ß√£o de caminh√µes e cont√™ineres, permitindo o controle mais preciso sobre as entradas e sa√≠das de ve√≠culos, a aloca√ß√£o de docas de carga e descarga e a rastreabilidade de mercadorias. O sistema pode ser integrado a outras plataformas de gest√£o log√≠stica, como WMS (Warehouse Management System) e TMS (Transportation Management System), oferecendo uma vis√£o abrangente do processo log√≠stico.  ‚Ä¢ A Import√¢ncia do YMS na Gest√£o Log√≠stica  Embora a ferramenta YMS seja extremamente valiosa para a efici√™ncia da log√≠stica, ela ainda √© pouco difundida comparada a outras solu√ß√µes mais conhecidas, como o WMS e o TMS. No entanto, seu impacto na opera√ß√£o de log√≠stica de empresas √© significativo por diversas raz√µes.  ‚Ä¢ Principais benef√≠cios do YMS:  1. Otimiza√ß√£o do Fluxo de Ve√≠culos e Cargas: Evita congestionamentos e reduz o tempo de espera nas docas.  2. Efici√™ncia Operacional: Melhora a aloca√ß√£o de ve√≠culos e o agendamento das atividades, reduzindo erros e aumentando a produtividade.  3. Redu√ß√£o de Custos: Minimiza o tempo de inatividade e danos a mercadorias, resultando em economia.  4. Visibilidade e Rastreamento: Proporciona informa√ß√µes detalhadas sobre a movimenta√ß√£o de cargas, facilitando a coordena√ß√£o entre equipes.  5. Apoio √† Tomada de Decis√µes: Oferece dados precisos que auxiliam no planejamento e identifica√ß√£o de gargalos operacionais.  Apesar de suas vantagens, o YMS ainda √© uma ferramenta pouco difundida e adotada por muitas empresas. Alguns dos motivos incluem o custo inicial de implementa√ß√£o, a resist√™ncia √† mudan√ßa por parte das equipes operacionais e a falta de conhecimento sobre os benef√≠cios do sistema. Muitas empresas ainda priorizam outras √°reas da log√≠stica, como o WMS e o TMS, em detrimento do gerenciamento de p√°tios, o que leva a uma subutiliza√ß√£o dessa solu√ß√£o estrat√©gica.  ‚Ä¢ Conclus√£o  O Yard Management System √© uma ferramenta fundamental para a otimiza√ß√£o da gest√£o log√≠stica, especialmente no que se refere ao controle e monitoramento das opera√ß√µes dentro dos p√°tios de distribui√ß√£o. Embora seja uma solu√ß√£o pouco difundida em compara√ß√£o com outras ferramentas log√≠sticas mais populares, o YMS oferece benef√≠cios claros, como aumento da efici√™ncia, redu√ß√£o de custos operacionais e melhoria na visibilidade das opera√ß√µes. √Ä medida que o mercado log√≠stico se torna cada vez mais competitivo, empresas que adotarem o YMS ter√£o um diferencial significativo, com opera√ß√µes mais √°geis, precisas e rent√°veis.  Portanto, a populariza√ß√£o do YMS no setor log√≠stico √© n√£o apenas desej√°vel, mas necess√°ria para acompanhar as demandas de um mercado cada vez mais din√¢mico e exigente.

text: Controle Proporcional, Integral e Derivativo (PID) de Temperatura üìà  O trabalho proposto pelo professor Irineu Alfredo Ronconi Junior e desenvolvido em parceria com, visa implementar um controle PID para regular a temperatura em uma c√¢mara t√©rmica. O gr√°fico mostra a temperatura saindo de 31¬∫ C (ambiente) e estabilizando em 37¬∫ C (temperatura desejada) ap√≥s algum tempo, controlada por um microcontrolador que ajusta a sa√≠da com base nos c√°lculos do PID, acionando um circuito de pot√™ncia para esquentar um resistor dentro da c√¢mera.  Mais informa√ß√µes: üí° O controle PID (Proporcional, Integral e Derivativo) √© amplamente usado em sistemas de automa√ß√£o para controlar vari√°veis como temperatura e velocidade. O componente proporcional corrige o erro atual, o integral ajusta erros constantes e o derivativo antecipa mudan√ßas para reduzir oscila√ß√µes, garantindo um sistema est√°vel e eficiente. name: Howard Brown, RCIC-IRB, MSc
position: Bilingual Corporate Immigration Consultant üá®üá¶ | Immigration & Citizenship Law | Managing Director, Lignum Immigration Services Ltd. | FIU Miami | Queens Faculty of Law | Providing Real Immigration Solutions
text: One of my earliest consultations almost resulted in a misrepresentation finding.From the initial assessment, the file appeared ideal‚Äînothing seemed suspicious. Fast forward to the final submission review, where I routinely ask statutory questions: ‚ÄúHave you ever been denied a visa for ANY country?‚Äù and ‚ÄúHave you ever been arrested?‚Äù These questions are often misunderstood or misrepresented. To my surprise, there was a prior infraction‚Äîa critical detail conspicuously omitted earlier, despite my thorough background questions during consultation.  Had I submitted the application unaware of this, a finding of misrepresentation would have been inevitable. The client had answered ‚ÄúNo‚Äù to the statutory questions. Intentional or not, this could have triggered a five-year ban from Canada and potentially tarnished my professional reputation‚Äîan all-too-common accusation against immigration consultants these days. This experience highlighted the importance of due diligence‚Äînot only for the client but for my credibility as a practitioner.  This is where mens rea (intent) meets actus reus (the act). I learned these terms in the context of misrepresentation during my immigration law training. Misrepresentation can occur whenever false information is provided, regardless of intent.  Consider last year‚Äôs controversy involving 700 international students accused of using fraudulent documents for study permits. Some had secured permanent residence, while others were still in limbo. Public reaction echoed the Queen of Hearts from Alice in Wonderland: ‚ÄúOff with their heads!‚Äù Yet, the Minister of Immigration deferred the matter to the courts. Some students succeeded in judicial review, while others faced removal.  The doctrine of stare decisis (legal precedent) plays a key role here. Recent case law has narrowed the scope of the ‚Äúinnocent mistake‚Äù defense, making it harder for applicants to claim ignorance in misrepresentation cases. Jurisprudence has affirmed that ignorance of the law is rarely excusable, though exceptions exist for genuine errors.  As immigration professionals, we navigate this evolving legal landscape daily. Of over 12,000 regulated practitioners, the majority of us work diligently, guided by ethics and law, to represent our clients effectively.  If we ask probing questions, it‚Äôs not to pry but to ensure truthful and accurate representation. Misrepresentation‚Äîintentional or not‚Äîcarries serious consequences. Trust us with the truth. Don‚Äôt lie‚Äîit‚Äôs a gamble no one can afford.  Photo courtesy: Pavel Danilyuk

name: Naomi Hardy
text: üåè Exciting updates for skilled workers and employers in Australia!  The Temporary Skill Shortage (TSS) subclass 482 visa underwent some key changes on Saturday, making it easier than ever for skilled talent to make Australia their new home:  üîπ Reduced Work Experience Requirement: Applicants now need just 1 year of relevant post-qualification experience (down from 2 years) to qualify.  üîπ Faster Pathway to Permanent Residency: Skilled workers can potentially gain PR in just 3 years‚Äî1 year of work experience + 2 years with their sponsoring employer.  üîπ Broader Talent Pool for Employers: Employers can now access a wider range of candidates, including recent graduates, and should plan for quicker PR sponsorships.  Australia is lowering barriers to entry, ensuring businesses have access to the global talent they need to thrive. If you're a skilled worker or an employer, now is the time to explore these opportunities!

name: Elizabeth Le
text: Australia: Join us on Wednesday, 27 November to hear from Australian Department of Home Affairs and Jobs and Skills Australia for the latest scoop.   Register here:  Earlier this year, it was announced that the Government would reduce the work experience requirement for the Temporary Skill Shortage (TSS) visa from two years to one year starting 23 November 2024. Since no legislative instrument were released to amend the regulations, this change did not happen.  We expect the new Skills in Demand (SID) visa (replacing the TSS) will have a one-year work experience requirement and the release of the SID visa might be the reason for the delay in the TSS visa changes.  While no commencement date has been provided for the Skills in Demand and National Innovation Visa programs, the Department of Home Affairs have confirmed fact sheets and resources are currently being developed to assist understanding when they start.  Join us!

name: QT Advisory
text: Notice on Further Optimizing the Policy for Hungarian Citizens to Enter China  From 00:00 on November 30, 2024 to 24:00 on December 31, 2025 Beijing time, China will pilot a unilateral visa-free policy for Hungary, expanding the reasons for entry to include business, tourism, visiting relatives and friends, transit, and exchange visits, and the visa-free stay period will be extended to 30 days.

Infelizmente para as empresas que n√£o aderem ao Programa Cidad√£, a licen√ßa-paternidade dos trabalhadores permanece sendo de 5 dias corridos, conforme previsto no artigo 7¬∫, inciso XIX, da Constitui√ß√£o Federal e regulamentado pelo artigo 10, ¬ß1¬∫, do Ato das Disposi√ß√µes Constitucionais Transit√≥rias (ADCT). Based on experience, here are some critical errors that applicants often make, which can impact their chances of success: ùüè. ùêåùê¢ùê¨ùê¨ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêëùêûùêúùê®ùê´ùêùùê¨ ùê®ùêü ùêèùê´ùêûùêØùê¢ùê®ùêÆùê¨ ùêïùê¢ùê¨ùêö ùêÄùê©ùê©ùê•ùê¢ùêúùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨ Many applicants forget or lose records of prior Canadian visa applications, whether approved or not. Canadian authorities maintain a history of all applications, so inaccuracies or omissions in PR applications‚Äîsuch as job history, education, or previous visa details‚Äîcan lead to discrepancies. Often, this happens when prior applications were handled by agents or consultants, and copies weren‚Äôt retained. 2. ùêáùê¢ùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùê®ùê´ ùêíùê§ùê¢ùê©ùê©ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêìùê´ùêöùêØùêûùê• ùêáùê¢ùê¨ùê≠ùê®ùê´ùê≤ Failing to disclose travel history is a common mistake. Applicants should provide logical explanations for their travels rather than omitting them entirely. Missing or hidden travel information can create doubts in a visa officer‚Äôs mind, negatively impacting the application. 3. ùêåùê¢ùê¨ùêÆùêßùêùùêûùê´ùê¨ùê≠ùêöùêßùêùùê¢ùêßùê† ùêÖùê¢ùêßùêöùêßùêúùê¢ùêöùê• ùêëùêûùê™ùêÆùê¢ùê´ùêûùê¶ùêûùêßùê≠ùê¨ Proof of funds is crucial, especially for business-class immigration. Applicants often try to arrange funds at the last minute, which may fail to meet the program's requirements. Understanding and preparing financial documentation early is vital. 4. ùêåùê¢ùê¨ùêúùê®ùêßùêúùêûùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨ ùêÄùêõùê®ùêÆùê≠ ùêÄùê†ùêû ùêãùê¢ùê¶ùê¢ùê≠ùê¨ Contrary to popular belief, there is no upper age limit for PR applications. While some programs favor younger applicants, others prioritize experience. Additionally, dependents under 22 at the time of application remain eligible, even if processing takes several years, as long as they remain unmarried and no major changes occur. 5. ùêÇùê®ùêßùêúùêûùêöùê•ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêåùêûùêùùê¢ùêúùêöùê• ùêàùê¨ùê¨ùêÆùêûùê¨ Hiding medical conditions will not benefit a PR application. Canada has policies and systems in place to assess applicants with serious medical issues fairly. Transparency is essential, and lawful pathways exist for those with health challenges to immigrate. ùêÄùêùùêØùê¢ùêúùêû ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêçùêûùê∞ ùêÄùê©ùê©ùê•ùê¢ùêúùêöùêßùê≠ùê¨ ùë≤ùíÜùíÜùíë ùë™ùíêùíéùíëùíìùíÜùíâùíÜùíèùíîùíäùíóùíÜ ùëπùíÜùíÑùíêùíìùíÖùíî: Maintain copies of all applications and documents submitted by you, your family, or consultants. These records will be invaluable for future use. ùë©ùíÜ ùëØùíêùíèùíÜùíîùíï ùíòùíäùíïùíâ ùë™ùíêùíèùíîùíñùíçùíïùíÇùíèùíïùíî: Share complete and accurate information with your consultants. They are there to guide you and help avoid surprises or refusals. ùëπùíÜùíóùíäùíÜùíò ùë®ùíëùíëùíçùíäùíÑùíÇùíïùíäùíêùíèùíî ùëªùíâùíêùíìùíêùíñùíàùíâùíçùíö: Before submission, review all forms and documents for accuracy. Request copies from your consultant and double-check every detail to minimize errors.  By avoiding these pitfalls and maintaining transparency, you can enhance your chances of a smooth and successful PR application process.

name: Sara T. Laca
text: Panama Qualified Investor Visa Panama implemente the qualified investor visa with Executive Decree 722 of October 15, 2020, for citizens of countries are not in the Friendly Nations Visa Program. The Qualified Investor Visa provides applicants Panama permanent residency through a qualifying investment in Panama, including the following options:  Real Estate: Invest $500,000 in a property Real Estate projects in pre-sale: sign a purchase and sale contract for the sum of $300,000 or more Investment in the Panamanian Stock Market: Purchase securities through a qualified and licensed Panamanian brokerage firm, for $500,000 or more. Fixed term deposit in the Banking Sector: open a time deposit of $750,000 in a qualified Panamanian bank.

text: üåü Major Update for Undocumented and DACA Students: The D3 Waiver üåü  Incredible news! The updated D3 Waiver, announced on June 18th, 2024, provides undocumented and DACA students with a significant pathway toward professional and personal advancement in the U.S. This waiver is a game-changer for Dreamers pursuing careers in high-demand fields like STEM and healthcare.  üìå What Makes the D3 Waiver So Important?  Pathway to an H1-B Visa: The waiver helps eligible students transition toward obtaining long-term work authorization, opening doors to an H1-B visa and broader career opportunities.  Forgiveness for Unlawful Presence: It includes a waiver of inadmissibility, forgiving the time undocumented students may have spent in the U.S. without lawful status, ensuring they can focus on building their future.  Streamlined Work Authorization: Reduces barriers to temporary employment opportunities for eligible students, making it easier to gain experience and contribute meaningfully to industries in demand.  ‚ú® What This Means for You This is a critical opportunity for undocumented students to pursue professional goals without the fear of deportation or the challenges of prior restrictions. It‚Äôs particularly vital for those aiming for careers in STEM, healthcare, and other high-demand industries.  üìñ Learn More: üîó Updated D3 Waiver for Undocumented and DACA Students  üí¨ Spread the Word! Share this post with friends, students, educators, and community leaders to ensure more people know about this life-changing opportunity. Together, we can support undocumented students in reaching their potential.

name: Sara T. Laca
text: Digital nomad visa in Panama, Republic of Panama The visa was created in 2021 to help remote workers stay in Panama while the country was experiencing a drop in tourism due to the pandemic. It's designed to encourage visitors to explore Panama's culture and natural beauty while also facilitating remote work.  Income tax benefits Both residents and non-residents are required to file taxes in Panama. But unlike other countries, residents and non-residents are only taxed on their Panama-earned income. Foreign-earned income is not taxed in Panama. If you work for an employer that withholds taxes, you do not need to file a tax return, and your taxes will be automatically withheld. But, if you‚Äôre self-employed, have multiple jobs without income withheld, or have a more complicated tax situation, you must file a tax return. How much you‚Äôll pay in taxes depends on whether you‚Äôre a resident or non-resident.

text: US Companies Cut Back H-1B Visa Sponsorships in 2024 In 2024, the United States Citizenship & Immigration Services data revealed a significant decrease in H-1B visa sponsorships by major U.S. companies. Despite Indian nationals continuing to lead H-1B applicant pool, several tech giants have scaled back their approvals, indicating a potential change in hiring preferences.  H-1B Visa: A Brief Overview  The H-1B visa program has long been a critical pathway for U.S. companies to hire foreign workers in specialized roles, particularly in the technology sector.  Indian nationals have historically been the primary beneficiaries of this program. However, the latest data suggests a growing trend of companies opting for alternative hiring strategies or prioritizing domestic talent.  Decline in H-1B Visa Sponsorships  The H-1B visa has traditionally been a crucial route for U.S. companies to hire foreign specialists, particularly from India. However, the 2024 data suggests a noticeable decline in the use of this visa. Many leading firms are now exploring alternative hiring strategies, focusing more on domestic talent and reducing dependency on international recruitment.   Top 10 H-1B Sponsors in 2024  Here‚Äôs a breakdown of the top 10 companies sponsoring H-1B visas in 2024, according to USCIS:  S. No. Company Name H-1B Approvals 2024 1 Amazon Com Services LLC 9,265 2 Infosys Limited 8,140 3 Cognizant Technology Solutions 6,321 4 Google LLC 5,364 5 Tata Consultancy Services Limited 5,274 6 Meta Platforms Inc 4,844 7 Microsoft Corporation 4,725 8 Apple Inc 3,873 9 HCL America Inc 2,953 10 IBM Corporation 2,906 Key Trends Impacting Sponsorship Numbers  Amazon remains the leading sponsor, but its H-1B approvals dropped from over 11,000 in 2023 to just above 9,000 in 2024. Indian IT firms like Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) experienced significant reductions in visa approvals, reflecting a shift in recruitment strategies. Almost all top 15 sponsors saw a decrease in visa approvals, hinting at broader trends in the U.S. job market and immigration policies. Impact of Reduced Visa Sponsorship  The reduction in H-1B visa sponsorships by top tech companies could have far-reaching implications:  Shift Towards Domestic Talent: Companies may increasingly focus on hiring & developing domestic talent to fill critical roles. Impact on Global Talent: The decline in H-1B visas could discourage skilled foreign workers from seeking opportunities in U.S. Potential Changes to Immigration Policies: The trend may influence future immigration policies & regulations. Broader Trends Observed in Fiscal Year 2024  The fiscal year 2024 (spanning October 1, 2023, to September 30, 2024) showed a consistent decrease in H-1B visa approvals across the board.  Analysts suggest that companies might be adapting to evolving economic conditions, regulatory changes, and geopolitical factors that affect international recruitment. name: Meagan Kirchner, Esq.
text: üí° Considering sponsoring a worker from Mexico or Canada on an H-1B? Many U.S. companies, when unable to find qualified talent domestically, have traditionally turned to the H-1B visa to fill high-demand, specialized positions. Over the years, the H-1B visa has become essential in industries like technology, making it popular among companies from Silicon Valley to Wall Street. However, with the rising demand, limited visa quotas, and increased competition in the H-1B lottery, many businesses face significant barriers. The high costs and uncertainty associated with the lottery process have discouraged many potential employers.  For employers frustrated with the H-1B process, the TN visa presents a viable alternative. The TN visa is available exclusively to Mexican and Canadian professionals seeking U.S. employment in specific fields, typically requiring a bachelor‚Äôs degree. Common eligible TN positions include engineers, accountants, scientists, computer systems analysts, architects, teachers, and medical professionals, offering a wide range of opportunities for specialized roles across industries.  Here are some of the key advantages that make the TN visa an appealing option over H-1B for eligible employers:  * No Annual Cap: Unlike the H-1B program, which has a strict annual quota, the TN visa does not have a limit on the number of visas issued. This means qualified professionals can apply for TN status year-round without worrying about a lottery system.  *Faster Approval Process: The TN visa offers a faster, more streamlined process than H-1B.  * Unlimited Renewals: While H-1B visas have a six-year cap, the TN visa can be renewed indefinitely, allowing employers to keep skilled employees for the long term without the time restrictions of other visa categories.  *Greater Flexibility in Employment Terms: The TN program is comparatively flexible, giving employers more freedom to define and negotiate terms, including compensation and benefits. This flexibility makes it easier to tailor employment conditions to the needs of both the employer and employee.  Due to these benefits, interest in the TN program has surged, especially among businesses seeking STEM talent. Although limited to Mexican and Canadian professionals, many companies find the program beneficial, particularly when hiring individuals with Spanish language skills to support a predominantly Spanish-speaking workforce.  At Kirchner Law, we have witnessed the rising demand for the TN program firsthand. For businesses considering H-1B sponsorship for Mexican or Canadian professionals, or struggling to fill a skilled position, the TN visa is well worth exploring as a straightforward and efficient alternative. And if you need help finding candidates, we can connect you with trusted TN recruitment resources to support your hiring needs.

name: China Charmission Travel
text: Exciting News! Visa-free stay for up to 30 stays!  Chinese has decided to expand the scope of visa-free countries. Starting from November 30, 2024, to December 31, 2025, a trial visa free policy will be implemented for holders of ordinary passports from Bulgaria, Romania, Croatia, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Malta, Estonia, Latvia, and Japan.  In addition, (more importantly!) China has decided to synchronize the optimization of entry policies, including exchange visits as a reason for visa exemption, and extending the visa free stay period from the current 15 days to 30 days. Starting from November 30, 2024, holders of ordinary passports from the aforementioned 9 countries, along with 38 other visa-free countries, coming to China for business, tourism, visiting relatives and friends, exchange visits, or transit for no more than 30 days, can enter without a visa.  A brief summary of China's comprehensive and unilateral visa-free policies as of November 22, 2024:  China has achieved comprehensive visa-free agreements with 25 countries: Solomon Islands, Georgia, Thailand, Singapore, Maldives, Kazakhstan, Antigua and Barbuda, Albania, United Arab Emirates, Barbados, Bahamas, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Dominica, Ecuador, Fiji, Grenada, Qatar, Mauritius, Serbia, Seychelles, San Marino, Suriname, Tonga, Armenia.  Unilateral visa-free policy for 38 countries: France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Spain, Malaysia, Switzerland, Ireland, Hungary, Austria, Belgium, Luxembourg, Australia, New Zealand, Poland, Denmark, Portugal, Greece, Cyprus, Slovenia, South Korea, Finland, Slovakia, Monaco, Andorra, Liechtenstein, Denmark, Norway, Iceland, Bulgaria, Romania, Croatia, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Malta, Estonia, Latvia, Japan.

name: Lucy Magardichian
text: Great article about the coveted H-B visa. The current visa numbers are not adequate to retain talent. The article states that the 85,000 annual limit (65,000 plus the 20,000 exemption) equals only 0.05% of the U.S. labor force. According to USCIS, the agency received H-1B registrations for 442,000 unique beneficiaries for FY 2025, five times more than the 85,000 ceiling. That means USCIS, in effect, was forced to block 300,000 to 350,000 high-skilled foreign nationals from working in the United States in 2024 due to the annual limit under U.S. law.

name: Dreem Relocation
text: ü§ù Finding Referees for Your O-1 / EB-1A Visa Recommendation Letters üì©  Obtaining both O-1 and EB-1A visas requires demonstrating extraordinary ability in your field. Strong recommendation letters are crucial for a successful application. Aim for 5-6 letters from respected professionals who can attest to your achievements and expertise. Quality matters more than quantity. A prominent expert's letter holds more weight than multiple letters from colleagues or clients.  Here's how to find suitable referees:  1Ô∏è‚É£ Leverage Your Professional Network: Start with coworkers, employers, subordinates, and freelancers. Even competitors can be valuable if you've collaborated or competed  2Ô∏è‚É£ Review Your Contact List: Your phone contacts or business cards might hold hidden opportunities. Don't overlook past connections  3Ô∏è‚É£ Ask Colleagues for Referrals: If your direct network lacks ideal candidates, ask colleagues for introductions to influential figures. Consider former advisors, supervisors, or clients  4Ô∏è‚É£ Consider Critics and Partners: Professionals you've worked with, whether critics or collaborators, might have valuable connections. Their feedback can demonstrate the depth of your contributions  5Ô∏è‚É£ Utilize LinkedIn: Create a detailed LinkedIn profile highlighting your accomplishments. Consider upgrading to premium for expanded reach  6Ô∏è‚É£ Explore Google Scholar or Other Indexes: If your work has been cited, reach out to those who cited it. They are experts in their field and can provide strong recommendations  7Ô∏è‚É£ Leverage Trade Unions or Professional Associations: These organizations often have lists of prominent members who can provide letters of support  Building Your List:  ‚Äî Identify Potential Referees: Compile a list with their names, positions, and contact details ‚Äî Reach Out: Request a recommendation letter, explaining why their input is valuable and how it can strengthen your application  üß† Remember: Many respected professionals are willing to support talented individuals. A strong recommendation letter can significantly enhance your O-1 / EB-1A visa application.

text: Coming soon: Jeju Island, a Special Self-Governing Province of South Korea, has announced its intentions to launch its own Digital Nomad Visa after a successful pilot.  This visa will be separate from South Korea's already established F-1-D Workation visa.  Currently, many tourists can stay in Jeju Island for up to a month visa-free, thanks to its special status and whilst no further details have been published yet, I would place an educated bet that they'll likely mirror many of the rules of the aforementioned F-1-D visa, but, they have announced that they want to publish their own "Jeju-style" visa, so maybe they'll go off-piste, we will just have to wait and see.  It could be an opportunity to offer a longer term or, even better, a lower salary requirement, as South Korea's F-1-D visa is currently one of the most "expensive" on the market, requiring a minimum income of around ¬£4,500pcm.  Note: Jeju Island's DN visa would only be valid in Jeju Island and would not extend to South Korea.  Source:

name: Michelle Abeckjerr
text: In recent years, I‚Äôve met with many individuals who entered the United States on a tourist visa and later filed asylum claims as a way to remain in the country and obtain work authorization. This trend has become particularly common among Argentine nationals. While it may seem like a temporary solution, I strongly advise against it.  The consequences of filing a frivolous asylum claim include permanent ineligibility for any future immigration benefits. Additionally, once an asylum claim is filed (and you are no longer maintaining a non-immigrant status), transitioning to another type of status‚Äîsuch as an O-1 visa for extraordinary ability, a student visa, or any other type of nonimmigrant status‚Äîis no longer possible.  Unfortunately, many of these individuals initially worked with "notarios" or form fillers who failed to explain the long-term implications of their actions. If you‚Äôre considering your immigration options, PLEASE seek informed legal advice. It‚Äôs incredibly disheartening to have consultations where I must tell a client that their case is essentially a ticking time bomb, likely leading to denial by an immigration judge.

name: digital x
position: Student at University of South Asia
text: Ending birthright citizenship has always been President-elect Donald Trump‚Äôs plan ‚Äî ensnared in controversies as this arises from the Constitution‚Äôs 14th Amendment. After he won the election, a claim went viral that his youngest son Barron Trump will also be not considered a US citizen under his policy as Melania Trump became a US citizen three months after Barron‚Äôs birth. The 14th Amendment granted citizenship to all persons ‚Äúborn or naturalized in the United States‚Äù including formerly enslaved people and has been interpreted to apply whether or not parents were in the country legally. But the claim regarding Barron is fake as Barron‚Äôs father Donald Trump was a lawful permanent resident when Barron was born and Donald Trump‚Äôs executive order planned for the first day of his second term in office requires at least one parent to be an American citizen or lawful permanent resident for their children to become automatic US citizens. Was Melania not a US citizen before Barron‚Äôs birth?  Melania came to the US in 1996 for modelling work. Melania and Donald Trump got married in 2005 and Barron Trump was born in March 2006. Melania became a citizen of the United States in July 2006. So it is true that Melania was not a US citizen when Barron was born.But Melania Trump was not an illegal resident either. She received an Einstein visa in 2001. Barron is a US citizen and Trump‚Äôs immigration policy won‚Äôt impact him  Trump said his order on birthright citizenship would not be retroactive. It will impact only the children born after it takes effect. Also, if one parent is a green card holder, then the child becomes a US citizen. Barron Trump has remained under the limelight this election campaign because he made his debut in his father‚Äôs campaign and also advised him on which podcasts to go to reach the maximum young audience. This was also the first time Barron voted.    barron-trump-melania-trump-is-barron-trump-not-a-us-citizen-under-donalds-immigration-plan-claim-viral-on-social-media

name: Blumefy
text: ùó°ùóºùòÅ ùóîùóπùóπ ùó®.ùó¶. ùó™ùóºùóøùó∏ ùó©ùó∂ùòÄùóÆùòÄ ùóîùóøùó≤ ùóñùóøùó≤ùóÆùòÅùó≤ùó± ùóòùóæùòÇùóÆùóπ‚Äîùó™ùóµùó∂ùó∞ùóµ ùó¢ùóªùó≤ ùóôùó∂ùòÅùòÄ ùó¨ùóºùòÇ ùóïùó≤ùòÄùòÅ?  Choosing the right U.S. work visa can shape your career, family life, and long-term opportunities.  With so many options, it‚Äôs easy to feel lost‚Äîbut don‚Äôt worry, we‚Äôve simplified it for you. Here's an overview of three popular visas, each with its unique strengths and challenges:  1. H-1B Visa: This is the most common starting point  Pros: -Lower entry requirements compared to other visas. -Spouses can work under H-4 EAD. -A potential pathway to a Green Card.  Cons: -Lottery-based system with low success rates (~20-30%). -Tied to your employer, limiting flexibility. -Restrictions on starting your own business.  2. L-1 Visa: This is for Intra-Company transfers  Pros: -No lottery‚Äîstreamlined application process. -Spouse gets immediate work authorization. -Faster Green Card via the EB-1C category.  Cons: -Only available for specific roles like managers or specialized professionals. -Limited ability to switch employers.  3. O-1 Visa: This is for exceptional talents  Pros: -No lottery or annual cap‚Äîapply anytime. -Renewable indefinitely. -Perfect for entrepreneurs and founders‚Äîno salary minimums.  Cons: -Extremely high qualification standards. -Expensive‚Äîlegal fees can exceed $10,000. -Spouses under the O-3 visa cannot work.  Each visa has unique trade-offs, and the best choice depends on your career goals, family priorities, and financial circumstances.  So, which path aligns with your goals? Our team at Blumefy can help!  Drop your questions in the comments or book a coaching session for tailored guidance. And don‚Äôt forget to share this post‚Äîit might just be the resource someone else needs!  Your journey to living and working in the U.S. starts here.

name: Vladyslav Galinskyi
position: Associate at Carter Lemon Camerons LLP
text: Permission letters issued under the Ukraine visa schemes will expire on 13 February 2025  Previously such permission letters have had no expiry date and therefore visa applicants who got it, could potentially use them to come to the UK within any period of time they wanted and needed to (be it within a 6-month period, a 1-year period or even longer).  From now on, the Home Office has amended the immigration rules and confirmed that such permission letters shall only be valid until 13 February 2025.  In practical terms, it means that those who have had their Ukraine visa scheme application submitted from outside the UK and approved, but who could not or did not want to come to the UK using that permission letter ‚Äì now have a limited time until 13 February 2025 to do so.  Please read the full article by the following link:

name: Silicon Sands Venture Studios
text: Italy is indeed a beautiful and diverse country with a rich history, delicious cuisine. Furthermore, there is a flat tax regime aimed at attracting wealthy individuals, retirees, and high-net-worth individuals to move to the country. This simplified tax regime offers favorable tax conditions for eligible individuals, making Italy an appealing destination for those seeking to establish residency in Europe.  Overall, Italy offers a unique blend of cultural, culinary, and lifestyle experiences, making it a desirable destination.
