name: Second Wind
text: Investing in a Troubled Business for an EB-5 Visa   Did you know that investing in a troubled business can be a path to your EB-5 visa? Here‚Äôs what you need to know!  What is a Troubled Business? A troubled business is one that has:  - Been in existence for at least two years. - Incurred a net loss during the 12- or 24-month period before the priority date on the immigrant investor‚Äôs Form I-526. - The loss must be at least 20% of the business‚Äôs net worth before the loss.  Key Benefits for EB-5 Investors:  - Job Maintenance: Instead of creating 10 new jobs, you can rely on job maintenance. You must show that the number of existing employees is, or will be, no less than the pre-investment level for at least two years. üìã‚úÖ  Why Consider a Troubled Business? name: Moronke Oladimeji
position: International Education Professional / QEAC / IEAA Associate Member
text: Was your Visa ever denied?  Receiving a visa rejection can be disheartening, but how you respond to this is very crucial. It's a deeply emotional experience, often leaving applicants feeling a mix of disappointment, frustration, and uncertainty.  Here are some common mistakes to avoid for future visa applications:  1) Don't panic or act impulsively. I have clients who discarded or tore visa refusal letters because they were upset. It‚Äôs natural to feel frustrated, but don‚Äôt rush into decisions or vent publicly. You may likely need the letter for future applications.  2) Don‚Äôt reapply immediately without understanding and addressing the reasons for the refusal. Many people believe that securing a visa is a matter of chance or luck. This is not true! A well-prepared application that meets the criteria has a much higher chance of approval than one filled with errors or missing information.  3 Don‚Äôt provide false information. Attempting to improve your chances by falsifying documents or providing inaccurate information is a serious offense. It can lead to bans or legal consequences, making it harder to obtain a visa in the future. Always declare previous visa refusals, if you ever had them, either as a main applicant or a dependant or in a group application.  4) Don‚Äôt overlook professional assistance. With diligence and the right guidance, you can improve your chances of approval. Seek advice from certified consultants to strengthen your reapplication. A professional will guide you on what to include in your new application and how to present it to Immigration authorities.  5) Don‚Äôt lose hope: A rejection is not the end of the road. You can succeed on a second or third attempt after carefully addressing the issues. Stay determined and be focused. With the right support and preparation, you can turn this setback into a stepping stone for future success.

position: I connect students with global labour market | Business Relations Manager at Durham University Business School
text: ‚ÄúCan you sponsor visas?‚Äù and ‚ÄúCan you sponsor a visa for me?‚Äù are, in my view, two very different questions.  Answering the first is straightforward:  Glassdoor can help you gauge potential salary ranges for the role you‚Äôre targeting, while LinkedIn is useful for finding current employees who might be open to an informational chat. Together, these can give you a rough idea for the first question.  Broadly speaking, the first question is about gathering general information.  The second question, however, is more complex. It requires understanding the company‚Äôs stance on individual cases, which takes time and often isn‚Äôt a straightforward yes or no when they first meet someone.  Unfortunately, I often see students mix up the two, directly asking HR the second question and receiving an ambiguous answer that offers little help.

text: Foreign-born doctors may also have the opportunity to apply for a permanent resident immigrant visa and Green Card through employment-based (EB) US visa programs (such as the EB-1 Visa or EB-2 Visa) or family sponsorship by an American citizen or US permanent resident or the Diversity Visa Lottery Program.  Yes, a foreign-trained doctor in Biochemistry from India can potentially qualify for an immigrant visa to the United States to establish an office, most likely through the EB-2 category of employment-based immigration, provided they can demonstrate exceptional ability in their field through research publications, awards, and other evidence of significant contributions to the field of biochemistry; they will also need to pass any necessary licensing exams required to practice in their desired state.  Key points to consider:  Visa category: The most likely pathway for a biochemistry doctor would be the EB-2 visa category, which is for individuals with advanced degrees and exceptional abilities in their field. Proof of exceptional ability: To qualify, the doctor would need to provide substantial evidence of their expertise, including peer-reviewed publications, presentations at major conferences, awards in the field, and significant research contributions. Labor certification: Depending on the specific circumstances, a labor certification may be required, which means a U.S. employer would need to demonstrate that there is a need for a foreign worker in the position. O-1 Visa option: If the doctor has achieved a high level of international recognition in their field, they may also be eligible for an O-1 visa, which is for individuals with extraordinary ability. State licensing requirements:  Even with an immigrant visa, the doctor will still need to pass the necessary licensing exams required by the State where they plan to practice.  What is E-2 Visa Category  An EB-2 visa is an employment-based visa ........ REMAINING POST IN COMMENTS

text: Old JeevanSathi ad: IIT, IIM, MNC New JeevanSathi ad: IIT, IIM, MNC, EB1 "Einstein Visa"   On a more real note ‚Äî  Ganesh, a civil engineer, is really eager to get his EB1 done.  But, he has a major concern. He messaged me this weekend,  Aditi, I didn‚Äôt attend IIT or IIM.  I'm from a middle-class family in a small town in India Even coming to the US was a struggle  Do I have even a 10% chance for EB1?  What made matters worse is that Ganesh looked up the profiles of folks who got their Einstein Visas on  That did not help his anxiety at all.  After observing all their profiles  Ganesh was convinced that he had to be a certain type of person to get EB1  Someone who is:  - Extremely extroverted - Ultra-confident speaking on stages - A Braniac with a 1000 patents & a 100 books  Ganesh is none of this.  In his mind, he lost the battle even before trying.  If only Ganesh knew the truth  That no matter how flashy an EB1 profile looks, every recipient had doubts.  Even me.  My EB1 was filed in November 2021.  September 2021 my lawyer informed me that USCIS was rejecting cases with 300 citations. I only had 61.  And yet, I got EB1 done.  So, I get where Ganesh is coming from.  If you find yourself in the same boat as Ganesh, then know this  Every EB1 recipient I know  - Started confused, and filled with doubts - Kept taking one step at a time - Persevered no matter what  They fought hard to make a way even when there was no way  Because they all accepted the hard reality that -  EB1 is the only escape route from perpetually living on H1-B.  Especially if you're Indian.   -----------------------------------------   PS: Want to know how EB1 recipients got their visas?  30 of them share their secret sauce  Grab it at[slash]draditipaul  üìå Link in comment.

text: üì¢ Newsflash Monday: Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs new in immigration this week. This week, we cover three major updates: a federal judge‚Äôs ruling against family reunification parole programs, a significant increase in H-2B visas for temporary workers, and revised medical exam guidance for Afghan nationals.  1Ô∏è‚É£ Federal Judge Blocks Family Reunification Parole Programs The biggest and upsetting news update is that a federal judge has struck down the ‚ÄúKeeping Families Together‚Äù parole process. The decision will impact thousands of families seeking a lawful path to a green card and stay united. The ruling states that the Biden administration overstepped its authority, creating uncertainty for affected families. Stay tuned as the government considers next steps, including potential appeals. I personally do not believe appeal will be successful or may even be attempted, but let‚Äôs see what happens.  2Ô∏è‚É£ DHS Adds more H-2B Visas for Fiscal Year 2025 The Department of Homeland Security has announced an additional 64,716 H-2B visas for temporary non-agricultural workers for FY2025. This supplemental increase aims to address labor shortages in seasonal industries like hospitality and construction. This is great news for businesses needing workers during busy seasons where there is a shortage of U.S. based workers!  3Ô∏è‚É£ USCIS Updates Medical Exam Guidance for Afghan Nationals USCIS has revised its medical exam requirements for Afghan nationals seeking immigration benefits, allowing certain waivers for tuberculosis testing. This update aims to streamline the process for Afghan applicants facing difficulties completing medical exams due to unique circumstances. It‚Äôs a positive move towards improving access to needed services for Afghan refugees and humanitarian parolees.  üëâ Questions about how these changes might affect you or anyone you know? text: üßê Understanding the USCIS Notice of Intent to Revoke (NOIR) for EB1A Visas  At Next League Program, we help professionals gain the skills and knowledge needed to navigate the EB1A Green Card process confidently and ethically. One important aspect to be aware of is the USCIS Notice of Intent to Revoke (NOIR).  Key Reasons:  1. ‚ö†Ô∏è Fraud or Misrepresentation:  It's essential to be honest and accurate throughout your EB1A application, as misrepresentation can have serious consequences, even years after your Green Card is issued.  2. üìÑ‚ùå Incorrect or Insufficient Evidence:  It‚Äôs crucial to submit comprehensive and well-documented evidence that meets the strict criteria for demonstrating Extraordinary Ability.  3. üö´ü§ù Unethical Practices and Tactics in Profile Building:  - Soliciting awards or accolades that are not genuinely earned.  - Ghostwriting or plagiarism, such as having others write articles or books under your name without your involvement.  - Manipulating academic metrics or buying citations to falsely enhance your profile.  - Acquiring patents without genuine innovation or being listed as a contributor without actual contribution.  - Manufacturing Letters of Support by soliciting using exaggerated and/or regulatory language not accurately reflecting your achievements or qualifications  4. üîÑ Change in Eligibility:  Wrongfully although inadvertently giving your employment status, achievements, or personal circumstances that affect your eligibility not in compliance  5. üìù‚ùó Submitting Improper Application:  Incorrectly misinterpreting the EB1A criteria and relevant standards in your submission and not submitting the right evidence that meets the legal standards.  How Next League Program Supports You:  - üéì Educational Resources:  We provide comprehensive materials to understand the process and avoid common pitfalls helping you build a strong, compliant EB1A Application.  - ‚öñÔ∏è Guidance on Ethical Practices:  We focus on ethical and authentic profile building strategies, steering clear of practices that could jeopardize your EB1A petition.  - üí° Strategic Support:  We provide guidance on presenting the best and most authentic version of yourself focusing on fundamental EB1A jurisprudence  Let‚Äôs focus on building a complete, robust case for you. Remember, the challenge isn't fitting into the criteria‚Äîit‚Äôs the lack of preparation and becoming a person of extraordinary excellence that truly commands the EB1A Green Card!  üöÄ Get it right the first time, and success will follow!  Have questions? name: Layovers.Amsterdam
text: Exploring Amsterdam on a Short Visit: A Guide for US and Canadian Travelers  Amsterdam, with its iconic canals, world-class art, and vibrant neighborhoods, is a perfect destination to explore, even if you‚Äôre short on time during a layover, stopover, or cruise visit. For US and Canadian citizens, travel to the Netherlands is straightforward, visa-free, and full of opportunities for cultural immersion.  No Visa Required As a US or Canadian traveler, you can enjoy a visa-free visit to Amsterdam for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. This makes it easy to explore the city‚Äôs treasures without dealing with lengthy paperwork.  Essential Travel Requirements While no visa is needed, there are a few important requirements:  Passport Validity: Ensure your passport is valid for at least three months beyond your planned departure from the Schengen Area.  Supporting Documents: Be prepared to show proof of accommodation, a return or onward ticket, and evidence of sufficient funds to cover your stay.  Why Travel Insurance is a Smart Choice Even for short visits, comprehensive travel insurance is highly recommended. It provides peace of mind in case of unexpected delays, health issues, or other travel hiccups.  Amsterdam‚Äôs charm is best experienced in any amount of time you have. With visa-free access and simple entry requirements, it‚Äôs a must-see destination for any traveler passing through Europe.

name: Karol D.
position: Business Immigration Supervisor @ Fragomen | Employment-Based Immigration and Program Management | Change Management | MBA in HR Management | Global Mobility Specialist
text: Understanding Who Can and Who Can‚Äôt Be Deported in 2025  The 2024 U.S. presidential election has reignited the national debate on immigration, with renewed pledges to deport millions of undocumented immigrants. However, immigration law is intricate, and deportation isn‚Äôt a straightforward process for every non-citizen.  ‚ö´Ô∏è Who Can Be Deported?  ‚ñ™Ô∏èUndocumented Immigrants: This group includes those who entered the U.S. without authorization or overstayed a visa. While there are protections for certain individuals, this population generally faces the greatest risk of removal. ‚ñ™Ô∏èCriminal Offenders: Non-citizens convicted of serious crimes, including aggravated felonies, drug offenses, and crimes involving moral turpitude, are often prioritized. U.S. immigration law is stringent on removing individuals with specific criminal backgrounds. ‚ñ™Ô∏èNon-Immigrants in Violation of Their Status: Those on student, work, or tourist visas who fail to comply with visa conditions (e.g., working without authorization) may be placed in removal proceedings. ‚ñ™Ô∏èNon-Citizens Who‚Äôve Committed Immigration Fraud: Individuals who provide false information on immigration applications or commit document fraud are at risk for deportation, as immigration agencies consider fraud a serious violation. ‚ñ™Ô∏èThose Who Pose National Security Threats: Individuals associated with terrorism or espionage, or who engage in activities threatening U.S. security, face immediate removal actions.  ‚ö™Ô∏è Who Can‚Äôt Be Deported?  ‚ñ´Ô∏èU.S. Citizens: While it may seem obvious, U.S. citizens are entirely protected from deportation, regardless of whether they were born in the U.S. or acquired citizenship through naturalization. ‚ñ´Ô∏èLegal Permanent Residents (LPRs) with Strong Ties: While green card holders can be deported for serious crimes, those with a clean record and strong community and family ties are less likely to face deportation. ‚ñ´Ô∏èAsylum Seekers and Refugees with Valid Status: Individuals granted asylum or refugee status are protected from deportation unless they commit certain crimes or have their status revoked. ‚ñ´Ô∏èProtected Groups (DACA, TPS): Certain programs like Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) and Temporary Protected Status (TPS) offer temporary protection. However, these protections are vulnerable to policy changes and legal challenges. ‚ñ´Ô∏èNon-Citizens Married to U.S. Citizens or with U.S.-Citizen Children: While not absolute protection, strong family ties can sometimes weigh in favor of individuals facing deportation, especially if they demonstrate good moral character and contribute positively to society.  The Complexities of Enforcement  Deportation is not always immediate or guaranteed. Due process rights allow individuals to present their case before an immigration judge. In this era of heightened immigration scrutiny, knowing your rights and staying informed about policy changes is essential for anyone affected by these potential shifts.

text: When you are going to invest in a U.S. company, there are certain procedures to follow both domestically and abroad in order to obtain an E-2 visa. A detailed explanation of the steps involved in getting an E-2 visa, specifically in the United States, is given here:  Who is eligible for an E-2 visa? Citizens of Treaty Countries like Bangladesh.  You must be a citizen of a treaty country that has an E-2 agreement with the United States. Investors and Essential Workers.  Investors: Investors who invest a substantial amount in a United States business. It is also applicable under the E-2 category for employees who will be employed in an executive or supervisory capacity, will have managerial duties, or possess special skills that are indispensable to the operation of the business.   Key Eligibility Criteria: 1. Ownership and Control: Investors need to be in possession of a significant managerial role or at least 50% of the company.  2. Ongoing Operations: Throughout the E-2 status, the company must continue to be active and run.  3. Dependents: E-2 dependent status may also be applied for by spouses and unmarried children under 21. Spouses can request permission to work.  To know more details or make an appointment at our USA office, call: 01941-571000, 01820-033221, 02226601299.

name: Glenn R. Morales Dalrymple
position: U.S. Consular Affairs Attorney at Law. Washington DC.St. Matthew's Cathedral 64. Senior Loyola. Red Mass, Faith & Justice. Clan Dalrympleüè¥Û†ÅßÛ†Å¢Û†Å≥Û†Å£Û†Å¥Û†Åø.
text: How could an American Consulate adjudicate a U.S. B1B2 nonimmigrant visa to a foreign applicant who was: 1) arrested while visiting the United States previously or 2) convicted in other country for a small crime of moralturpitude, but the charges were dismissed in the U.S. or abroad?  Crimes of moral turpitude have visa - consular consequences for foreign citizens.  Some U.S. States or foreign countries grand theft or petty theft are crimes of moral turpitude at Consular level and there are exceptions. Particular small crimes in the U.S. or abroad are not a crime of moral turpitude.  As per INA 212(a)(2)(A)(i)(1) and as per experiences in the consular window, , a foreign citizen who was convicted of a crime of moral turpitude in the United States or abroad is subject to a U.S. visa refusal.  There are nonimmigrant - immigrant waivers for those found inadmissible under INA 212(a)(2)(A)(i)(1) and need to remain eligible for visa - admission to the United States.

name: The Scheer Immigration Law Group
text: Preparing for a consular interview can seem overwhelming, especially when it‚Äôs one of the final steps in the immigration process. Understanding the process, knowing what to expect, and preparing properly can help reduce stress and give you the confidence to succeed. This interview is an important meeting, so a thorough understanding and preparation will be helpful for both you and the consular officer. By following a checklist and keeping in mind some important tips, you can feel better prepared and increase your chances of a positive outcome. Below are steps and advice to help guide you through what to expect before, during, and after the consular interview. At, The Scheer Immigration Law Group, we are here to guide you through the legal process and help you navigate the complexities of your case.  Understanding the Purpose of a Consular Interview The consular interview is a meeting with a consular officer that helps them make a decision about your visa application. This interview typically takes place at a U.S. embassy or consulate in your home country and is an essential part of the visa approval process. Consular officers ask questions to confirm your identity, background, and reasons for seeking a visa to the United States. They may also look at your qualifications, whether you meet the visa requirements, and if you plan to follow U.S. immigration laws once you arrive. Being clear about the purpose of the interview helps you understand the kinds of questions they might ask and allows you to prepare appropriate answers that are honest and precise.  Gathering and Organizing Your Documents One of the most important steps is to gather all the required documents. Having your paperwork ready will help your interview go smoothly. These documents often include your passport, appointment confirmation, visa application confirmation, a photo that meets U.S. visa requirements, and any other documents required based on your visa type. For example, if you‚Äôre applying for a family-based visa, you may need to provide birth certificates or marriage certificates. For work visas, you might need employment contracts or letters from your employer. Having a checklist of all required documents and going through it carefully will help you ensure you are well-prepared. It‚Äôs important to organize these documents neatly, preferably in a folder or file, so they are easy to access during the interview.  To Learn More Please Click Our Link:

name: Naimeesha Murthy
position: Product Management & GTM Strategy Lead | Founder, Creator & Community Builder | Board Member & EB1A Recipient (Ft. in Forbes, Business Insider, BuiltIn)
text: 7 Must-Know FAQs to Make Your EB1A Publications Stand Out    Happy Friday! Keeping the EB1A FAQ series going. If you‚Äôre working on your EB1A visa, especially in Product Management or Tech, having the right publications can really boost your application. Here are some FAQs to help you showcase them and stand out!  1. What types of publications help with an EB1A application? Focus on major media, professional journals, trade publications, and academic outlets. The goal is to show that your work is widely respected and recognized in your field.  2. Do I need a lot of citations for my publications to count? Not necessarily! While citations can help, it‚Äôs more about the impact of your work. Even if citations are minimal, as long as your work is being recognized and used in your field, it can make a strong case.  3. How many publications should I aim for? USCIS values quality over quantity, so make sure each publication demonstrates relevance and significance. A solid target is between 5-10 impactful publications.  4. Does it matter if it‚Äôs online or in print? Both work, but print publications are sometimes easier to verify because you can show hard numbers on circulation. If your work is online, ensure viewership is organic and substantial. USCIS may look closer at online metrics.  5. Are conference papers a good idea? Absolutely! Presenting at peer-reviewed conferences shows active contribution to your field and adds credibility to your expertise.  6. Do trade journals or industry magazines count? Yes! Trade journals are industry-specific and can show that you‚Äôre respected by professionals in your area, which adds weight to your application.  7. Why is major media coverage important? Major media proves that your work is respected by a larger audience. It gives your EB1A application an extra boost by showing broad recognition.  Remember! Each publication you showcase should highlight your impact and expertise in the field. With these tips, you‚Äôre ready to make your EB1A publications stand out. Good luck!  If you have any questions - feel free to grab a 1x1 with me. Link in comments below. __

For business travelers, here‚Äôs the impact in a nutshell:  üìÖ Plan Ahead: Business trips to the UK will require a quick online ETA application. Once approved, it links directly to your passport and is valid for multiple trips over two years.  ‚è© Streamlined Entry: While ETA adds an additional step in the travel process, it‚Äôs designed to be fast and should help reduce wait times at border control, with approvals in just 48-72 hours.  üìù Prep Checklist: Make ETA part of your standard travel prep! name: Second Wind
text: EB-5 Direct: Green Card by Investing in Your Own Business: https://lnkd.in/efcjnyXT   The EB-5 program was originally introduced by Congress as a way for entrepreneurs to invest in the US economy and create jobs in the United States.  Later, the Regional Center Pilot Program was established, and today, more than 90% of all EB-5 visas are issued through Regional Center projects.  However, investing in your own business ‚Äì with a Direct EB5 Investment and obtaining a Green Card through your own project is still an option.  In this short video, we will explain requirements of EB-5 direct, examples projects, steps, advantages, and disadvantages.

name: Law Firm EVCHATOV & PARTNERS
text: Foreigners entering Russia will be required to submit biometrics from December 1, 2024. The experiment on submitting biometrics consists of 2 stages. At the 1st stage, foreigners entering through the international airports of Moscow (Domodedovo, Sheremetyevo, Vnukovo) and the Moscow region (Zhukovsky), as well as through the automobile checkpoint in the Orenburg region (Mastakovo), will submit biometrics (photo and fingerprints) at checkpoints. In the future, when applying to the Multifunctional Migration Center of Moscow, they will undergo genomic registration and receive an electronic card of a foreign citizen. At the 2nd stage, from June 30, 2025, foreigners entering visa-free through any checkpoint will submit biometrics in advance through the EBS mobile application and submit an application with their data and information about the purpose of the visit through the Gosuslugi application. In the future, an electronic card with a QR code will be used to identify foreigners in Russia. According to Government Resolution No. 1510 of 07.11.2024, the experiment will last until June 30, 2026 and will not affect some foreigners: ‚Ä¢ Citizens of Belarus, ‚Ä¢ Children under 6 years of age, ‚Ä¢ Diplomats, ‚Ä¢ Employees of diplomatic missions and consular offices of foreign states, international organizations accredited in the Russian Federation and their representative offices, and members of their families.  Designed by Freepik

name: SC Migration and Visa Services
position: Registered Migration Agent at S&C Migration and Visa Specialists
text: Understanding ANZSCO Codes and Their Importance in Australian Migration   For anyone considering skilled migration to Australia, the ANZSCO code is a critical factor in your application process. Here‚Äôs why:  1. Visa Eligibility: Your occupation must be listed on Australia's Skilled Occupation List (SOL), which is determined by your ANZSCO code.  2. Skills Assessment: The relevant assessing authority uses your ANZSCO code to evaluate whether your qualifications meet Australian standards.  3. Points Calculation: Your ANZSCO code is essential for the points system, which determines your eligibility for a skilled visa and your chances of receiving an invitation to apply.  It‚Äôs crucial to ensure your occupation matches the correct ANZSCO code to avoid any delays or complications in your visa process.  For expert guidance on ANZSCO codes and the skilled migration process, contact S&C Migration and Visa Specialists! name: ZAAF Law & Immigration
text: The EB-5 visa program has several mandatory requirements for investors, including:  1. Investment Amount: ‚Ä¢ The minimum investment is $1.05 million for a standard EB-5 investment. ‚Ä¢ If the investment is in a Targeted Employment Area (TEA) ‚Äî a rural or high-unemployment area ‚Äî the minimum investment is reduced to $800,000. 2. Job Creation: ‚Ä¢ The investment must create at least 10 full-time jobs for U.S. workers within two years of the investor‚Äôs entry into the U.S. as a conditional permanent resident. ‚Ä¢ These jobs must be full-time positions (35+ hours per week) and available to U.S. citizens, lawful permanent residents, or other authorized workers. 3. At-Risk Investment: ‚Ä¢ The investment funds must remain ‚Äúat risk‚Äù throughout the entire investment period, with no guarantees of return. This means there must be a chance of both profit and loss. 4. Source of Funds: ‚Ä¢ Investors must prove that their funds come from a lawful source. This could include income, sale of assets, gifts, or loans (as long as the loan is secured by the investor‚Äôs assets). 5. Direct or Regional Center Investment: ‚Ä¢ Investors can choose to invest directly in a business or through a USCIS-approved regional center. Regional centers can help meet job creation requirements by counting indirect job creation. 6. Compliance with the Business Plan: ‚Ä¢ A comprehensive business plan must be submitted, detailing how the investment will meet EB-5 requirements. If investing in a regional center project, this is usually provided by the center. 7. Application Process: ‚Ä¢ File Form I-526 (Immigrant Petition by Alien Investor) to initiate the EB-5 process. ‚Ä¢ After approval and obtaining conditional permanent residency, file Form I-829 to remove conditions and receive permanent residency after fulfilling EB-5 requirements.  Would you like more details on any specific part? Contact us at : 929-919-6969

name: Alexandra Law
position: Senior Counsel @ Waypoint Immigration USA | Immigration Law
text: Now more than ever, it's important to be educated about your immigration status.  Knowledge can be powerful.  Gather as many resources as you can, ask questions, and plan for both the short-term and long-term. And when in doubt, don‚Äôt hesitate to get a second opinion.  For example, did you know that as an H-1B visa holder, your employer may be required by law to continue paying you the wage specified in the H-1B petition, even if you are laid off or not actively working? This requirement often continues through the petition period until there is a "bona fide" termination of the employment relationship.  If your employer terminates your employment, they likely need to follow these steps for it to be considered a bona fide termination:  üîπ Notify you of your termination. üîπ Notify USCIS of your termination. üîπ Pay for your reasonable costs of return transportation.  Note, if you secure a new job and your new employer files another H-1B petition for you, this likely will be treated as an express termination of your previous employment, ending any further wage obligations of your prior employer.  Have questions about your H-1B or nonimmigrant status? Feel free to schedule a consultation using the link on my profile!

name: Badrinath Balavenkateshan
position: I Help Individuals & Companies Navigate UK Immigration | Director & Senior Immigration Consultant | Lawyer
text: üö® Update: Introducing the No Time Limit Application for Legacy Document Holders  The UK has introduced a No Time Limit (NTL) application for individuals with indefinite leave to enter or remain, who cannot currently register for a UKVI account to access the new digital eVisa system.  Here‚Äôs what you need to know:  üìå Who Should Apply?  This application is relevant for those holding a *legacy document* that previously allowed entry into the UK without issues. With the move to digital immigration records, legacy documents will no longer be accepted for border entry, making it essential to apply for an NTL if you still hold one.  üìå Why Apply for an NTL?  The NTL application ensures your status is up-to-date in the UK‚Äôs digital immigration system. It‚Äôs more than just confirming your status, it involves a review of your immigration record to verify that you still hold indefinite leave to enter or remain.  üìå Eligibility Criteria  You may be eligible to apply if: - You have indefinite leave to enter or remain (British and Irish citizens are not eligible). - You‚Äôre currently in the UK. - You can provide evidence of your identity and presence in the UK, such as official correspondence addressed to you. - Your indefinite leave hasn‚Äôt been renounced or lapsed, and there are no grounds to revoke it. - You do not have any pending immigration applications.  üìå Required Documentation  Submit current or expired immigration documents, if available. If not, explain your circumstances and provide any supporting evidence to verify your status. The Home Office may check its records if you lack documentation.  üìå Processing Time and Travel Rights  NTL applications are free and aim to be processed within six months. While your application is under review, you may travel outside the Common Travel Area without your application being withdrawn.  üìå Alternative Options if Rejected  If your application is declined, you may explore other options, like a returning resident visa, if you've lost your indefinite leave.  For support with your No Time Limit application, or to check your eligibility, feel free to reach out to me!

name: Adaeze Victoria Akuneme (BSC,PGD)
text: Did you know that ancient Greeks believed eating beans would conjure up the souls of the dead?    In ancient Greek culture, beans were considered taboo due to the notion that they contained the spirits of the deceased. This superstition stemmed from the idea that beans resembled eggs, symbolizing birth and death.  Fast-forward to today, and Greece has transformed into a haven for:  Wine connoisseurs: Greece boasts some of the world's finest wines, with ancient vineyards and indigenous grape varieties.  Golden Visa seekers: Greece offers a residency program, granting non-EU citizens a Golden Visa in exchange for investing in Greek real estate.  What do you think about this remarkable transformation?  Share your thoughts on:  1. Unusual food taboos from history 2. Cultural significance of food in ancient civilizations 3. Fascinating food myths and legends 4. Greece's modern wine industry 5. Benefits of the Golden Visa program  Let's explore Greece's captivating past and vibrant present!

name: Bhatia Consultancy Services
text: How to Use an SOP Sample for an Australia Student Visa Application Referring to a sample SOP for an Australian student visa can help clarify how to structure and write your own SOP. However, following some guidelines can enhance your understanding of how to effectively use the sample. Understand the Structure: Carefully examine the structure of the sample SOP. Note the Word and Page Limits: Pay attention to word count and page requirements. Analyze Vocabulary and Sentence Patterns: Observe the choice of words and sentence flow. Use the Tone and Style as a Guide: Let the tone and writing style inform your own approach. Break Down Each Section: Analyze each part of the sample SOP and use it as a model for drafting your own. Importance of an SOP for an Australian Student Visa Why is an SOP essential for an Australian student visa? An SOP plays a crucial role in the visa application process because: It can increase your likelihood of securing a visa. It helps visa officers assess the sincerity and honesty of your application. It provides insight into your potential and academic goals. A well-crafted SOP effectively communicates your intentions and background to the visa officials. It offers an understanding of your identity, aspirations, and motivations. How Does an SOP for an Australian Student Visa Differ from Other Countries? SOPs for student visas vary depending on the destination country. Here‚Äôs what sets Australia‚Äôs SOP apart: The SOP for Australia is written in a clear, structured format. While some countries require video essays, Australia typically prefers text-based SOPs. Unlike many countries where SOPs are mandatory for all programs, Australian universities may require SOPs only for certain disciplines, such as arts, business, and education. The Australian SOP emphasizes factual information over storytelling. It seeks evidence of your accomplishments and potential. The Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) Requirement The Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) is a vital aspect of the Australian student visa application process. By understanding its purpose, criteria, and required documentation, applicants can better demonstrate their intent to study in Australia temporarily. Documenting GTE Intentions: To show genuine intentions, applicants must provide specific documents, such as: Statement of Purpose (SOP): A detailed statement outlining your motivation for studying in Australia, academic objectives, and career aspirations. Academic Records: Official transcripts and certificates from prior education. Financial Capacity: Proof of funds to cover tuition, living costs, and return travel. English Language Proficiency: Evidence of meeting language requirements for the chosen program. Health and Character Documents: Medical examination results and police clearance certificates. name: Traderoot
text: The finance sector is highly regulated and is also governed by world-leading standards to ensure compliance, security and service. One of the main standards is EMV, but what is it? EMV stands for,andand is a global standard for interoperation of integrated circuit cards (also called IC cards or chip cards) and IC-card-capable point of sale (POS) terminals and automated teller machines (ATMs), for the purpose of authenticating credit and debit card transactions. Learn more about various other fintech terms in our glossary here:or email us onto discuss how we can help you start perfecting commerce.

name: Santosh Siwakoti
position: College Administrator | High School Administration, Events Coordination, Public Relations
text: Reducing the age limit for Temporary Graduate visa applications from 50 to 35 unfairly affects international students whi have been onshore prior to the enactment; primary those pursuing Master's by coursework. How does this contribute to the educational integrity? It rather creates disparities and unfairness amongst international students. This change overlooks their contributions and potentials, hindering Australia's reputation as a welcoming destination for global talent. It's crucial for fairness and equity to prevail in Australia's visa policies to uphold the commitment to global talent and diversity. Its time for a fair review that considers all stakeholders' interests. This is not against legislation of the age bar for 485 but at least a fair transition should be given to those international students who were already onshore prior to the legislation

name: Fatima HASSOU
text: A simple guide to PCI compliance  Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards (PCI DSS) sets the minimum standard for data security. Here‚Äôs a step-by-step guide to maintaining compliance.  Since 2005, over 11 billion consumer records have been compromised from over 8,500 data breaches. These are the latest numbers from The Privacy Rights Clearinghouse, which reports on data breaches and security breaches impacting consumers dating back to 2005.  To improve the safety of consumer data and trust in the payment ecosystem, a minimum standard for data security was created. Visa, Mastercard, American Express, Discover, and JCB formed the Payment Card Industry Security Standards Council (PCI SSC) in 2006 to administer and manage security standards for companies that handle credit card data. Before the PCI SSC was established, these five credit card companies all had their own security standards programs‚Äîeach with roughly similar requirements and

text: Your visa approval depends on the country‚Äôs immigration policies.   (only partially true)    That doesn‚Äôt mean policies don‚Äôt matter. name: Rajshekar Tubachi
position: Founder and Educational Consultant @ Maven | Study Abroad, Workshop Facilitation
text: üö® Breaking News: Opposition Blocks Proposed Cap on International Student Numbers in Australiaüö®  The Australian government's recent proposal to cap international student numbers has hit a roadblock, with the opposition stepping in to halt the plan. This decision has significant implications for the education sector, economy, and international students themselves.  Key Points:  1. Economic Concerns: Critics have labeled the cap as "economic vandalism," warning of potential financial losses and job cuts within the sector. Universities could face a loss of AUD $4 billion due to declining enrolments and visa processing delays.  2. Sector Impact: The opposition argues that the proposed caps would not solve issues like housing shortages and cost of living pressures. Instead, they claim it could exacerbate these problems.  3. Visa and Migration: Ongoing visa processing challenges remain a significant hurdle for international students, impacting Australia's reputation as a top study destination.  4. Global Reputation: Maintaining Australia's standing in international education is crucial. Prolonged policy uncertainty could deter potential students and impact the country's cultural and economic landscape.  Expert Opinions:  - Dr. Peter Hendy and Vicki Thomson have emphasized the need for policies that enhance the sector's competitiveness and ensure stability.  ### Conclusion:  While the opposition's decision prevents immediate restrictions, it underscores the urgent need for a balanced and stable policy framework. The goal is to support the growth of Australia's international education sector while addressing migration and infrastructure challenges.  As we navigate these changes, collaboration between policymakers, educational institutions, and stakeholders is essential to maintain Australia's position as a leading destination for international students.  Let's connect and discuss the future of international education in Australia! üåè  üìö

name: Felipe S.
position: Autistic | Security Research | Developer | Machine Learning | Python | C/C+ |
text: Aos javeiros de plant√£o, o artigo aborda um problema cr√≠tico de seguran√ßa em aplica√ß√µes web Java, a vulnerabilidade conhecida como Missing-Owner-Check (MOC). Essa vulnerabilidade pode permitir acesso n√£o autorizado a dados sens√≠veis dos usu√°rios.  Os autores prop√µem uma nova abordagem, chamada MOCGuard, que visa identificar e analisar essas vulnerabilidades de forma eficaz. A abordagem MOCGuard adota uma an√°lise centrada no banco de dados para detectar vulnerabilidades MOC, onde o processo √© dividido em duas fases principais:  An√°lise Sem√¢ntica do Banco de Dados e Verifica√ß√£o das Checagens de Propriet√°rio. Na primeira abordagem, o MOCGuard identifica tabelas que armazenam informa√ß√µes dos usu√°rios e infere quais dados pertencem a esses usu√°rios, essa an√°lise garante que os dados sejam corretamente atribu√≠dos aos seus respectivos propriet√°rios.  J√° a segunda abordagem, ap√≥s identificar os dados pertencentes aos usu√°rios, o MOCGuard examina se as checagens de propriet√°rio est√£o implementadas corretamente tanto no n√≠vel SQL quanto no n√≠vel Java. Essa verifica√ß√£o garante que apenas os propriet√°rios dos dados possam acess√°-los.  Essa abordagem  foi testada em 30 aplica√ß√µes Java open-source e 7 aplica√ß√µes industriais, resultando na descoberta de 161 vulnerabilidades MOC confirmadas, das quais 73 foram atribu√≠das a identificadores CVE, em compara√ß√£o com outras abordagens existentes, como o MACE, o MOCGuard demonstrou um desempenho superior em termos de precis√£o e recall.

name: Alexandra Law
position: Senior Counsel @ Waypoint Immigration USA | Immigration Law
text: Just a quick note: The lawsuit settlement that led to USCIS agreeing to adjudicate I-539 and I-765 applications alongside the principal‚Äôs I-129 filing for H-4 and L-2 visa holders is set to expire on January 18, 2025.  This practice has been useful in helping H-4 spouses manage processing times and avoid gaps in work authorization during the H-4 EAD extension process. We haven‚Äôt received any updates on whether USCIS will continue this practice. If you're in the H-1B/H-4/H-4 EAD extension process, consider filing with premium processing now to benefit before any potential changes take effect.  Have questions about H-1B or career planning? Feel free to schedule a consultation using the link on my profile!

name: Keith James
position: Ai enthusiast| Legal ops specialist| Immigration lawyer
text: üö® Navigating Citizenship Refusals: A Step-by-Step Guide to Appeals üö®  If your Australian citizenship application has been refused, you may have the right to appeal this decision! However, the appeal process is very different from visa refusals, and understanding the procedure is key to your success.  Here‚Äôs a breakdown of how it works:  1Ô∏è‚É£ Key Difference: Unlike visa refusals, citizenship refusals are appealed to the General Division of the Administrative Review Tribunal (ART). 2Ô∏è‚É£ Department Representation: The Department of Home Affairs will appoint lawyers to argue against your case during the merits review. 3Ô∏è‚É£ T-Document Disclosure: Within 5 weeks of filing your application, the Department will serve you a T-document‚Äîa complete copy of your case file. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Timelines to Prepare: The ART will schedule a case conference within 8‚Äì10 weeks of filing the appeal. This is much faster than visa refusal appeals, so preparation is crucial!  üí° Pro Tip: Be proactive! Understanding the T-document and preparing for the case conference early can set the stage for a strong appeal.  Stay tuned‚Äîmy next post will dive into the nuances of case conferences at the AAT and how to navigate them effectively!

text: Pacote fiscal est√° definido, mas faltam ajustes de reda√ß√£o; an√∫ncio deve ser 4¬™ ou 5¬™  O pacote fiscal do governo brasileiro foi finalizado, mas ainda carece de ajustes na reda√ß√£o dos textos legais. A expectativa √© de que o an√∫ncio oficial seja feito entre quarta e quinta-feira, dependendo dos alinhamentos finais, com a equipe de comunica√ß√£o aguardando um sinal verde para a divulga√ß√£o.  Esse pacote, que visa garantir o cumprimento das metas fiscais e fortalecer o arcabou√ßo fiscal do pa√≠s, contempla medidas que, entre outras coisas, buscam controlar o or√ßamento de forma mais rigorosa, principalmente nas √°reas essenciais como sa√∫de e educa√ß√£o. Essas √°reas foram especialmente protegidas, conforme decis√£o do presidente Luiz In√°cio Lula da Silva, que tem reafirmado a import√¢ncia de garantir o funcionamento dessas pol√≠ticas p√∫blicas sem cortes.  No entanto, outras √°reas do or√ßamento sofrer√£o revis√µes, com o foco no ajuste fiscal e no controle de despesas. O governo tamb√©m pretende fortalecer mecanismos de controle de benef√≠cios sociais, incluindo a implementa√ß√£o de biometria para garantir mais efici√™ncia e seguran√ßa na distribui√ß√£o de benef√≠cios, evitando fraudes.  Apesar da resist√™ncia inicial de ministros de √°reas sociais, o pacote foi ajustado para equilibrar a necessidade de conten√ß√£o fiscal com a manuten√ß√£o de direitos fundamentais, algo que tem sido um ponto de tens√£o dentro do governo.  A equipe econ√¥mica, liderada pelo ministro Fernando Haddad, tem buscado solu√ß√µes para avan√ßar nas negocia√ß√µes e garantir a aprova√ß√£o do pacote, que promete dar um novo rumo √† pol√≠tica fiscal do pa√≠s e √† sua estabilidade econ√¥mica no longo prazo

name: Danielle Goldman
position: Building immigration solutions for foreign national innovators, entrepreneurs, and experts.
text: TLDR: change is coming in the immigration world üåé   Here our take at The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues‚Ä¶  üëâImmediate Effects (1st Year):  H-1B Visa Policies: The administration might ease some H-1B restrictions but introduce new barriers like higher wage thresholds and stricter "specialty occupation" definitions.  Travel Bans and Consular Scrutiny: There may be a reinstatement and expansion of travel bans, leading to prolonged visa processing times and increased scrutiny for certain applicants.  Visa Backlogs: Efforts to address visa processing delays might be limited by staffing shortages and strict vetting procedures.  üëâMid-Term Effects (Year 1-2):  Shift to Merit-Based H-1B System: The administration may pursue a merit-based H-1B system favoring highly skilled and highly paid applicants, requiring legislative approval.  Changes to OPT Program: Tighter eligibility and increased employer compliance for the OPT program could deter smaller companies and reduce international student enrollment.  Consular Processing: Additional resources may enhance security at consulates but maintain high scrutiny levels for applicants from high-risk countries.  üëâLong-Term Effects (Year 3-4):  Comprehensive Immigration Reform: The administration could prioritize permanent residency for highly skilled professionals while maintaining restrictive caps for other categories.  Domestic Visa Renewals: Allowing certain visa renewals within the U.S. could streamline processes but may be limited by strict vetting.  Consular Operations: Strategic appointments of officials may have lasting effects on visa processing standards, leading to persistent disparities.   Check out the full article ‚¨áÔ∏è

name: Curtis Poling (ÂçöÊûó)
position: Accomplished CEO & Founder | Facilitating Asia & European CBI - US EB-5/ E-2 Visa Investment Programs | Bridging Global Talent & Opportunities
text: U.S. employers are on the verge of facing ‚Äúthe largest labor shortage the country has ever seen,‚Äù according to a report from Lightcast, a leading labor market data and analysis firm. This crisis is driven by several factors, including the ‚ÄúSilver Tsunami‚Äù of Baby Boomers retiring, declining birth rates, a preference among younger generations for office-based jobs requiring college degrees, and a shrinking labor force participation rate among working-age adults. ‚ÄúBut this wasn‚Äôt the storm itself; it was only a precursor to the real thing,‚Äù Lightcast warned. The retirement of Boomers is a structural change, not a cyclical one, and the declining labor force participation rate of younger generations will be difficult to reverse, the report explained. The convergence of these factors will result in crucial segments of the economy missing key workers, including the food services industry and police, firefighting and sanitation, Lightcast explained. This is creating what the namesake report calls, ‚ÄúThe Rising Storm.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt would be tempting to think the storm has passed ‚Äî with ‚ÄòThe Great Resignation‚Äô over, the labor market will return to business as usual,‚Äù the report noted. At CN Global, we‚Äôve successfully placed numerous candidates during this challenging time, delivering outstanding results for both employers and employees. Let us help you navigate these workforce challenges‚Äîreach out to us today! The EB-3 Visa Program: A Game-Changer for the Manufacturing Sector The EB-3 visa program provides a critical solution to labor shortages, particularly in manufacturing. By opening access to a global talent pool, it ensures businesses can secure reliable employees for essential roles that are increasingly difficult to fill domestically. Why EB-3 is the Future of Manufacturing Workforce Development: 1. Solving Labor Shortages: Manufacturing faces an ever-widening workforce gap, especially in entry-level positions where automation isn‚Äôt a viable replacement. EB-3 workers can bridge this gap, ensuring smooth and efficient operations. 2. Workforce Stability and Retention: Unlike short-term work visas, the EB-3 program offers a pathway to permanent residency. This fosters long-term employee loyalty, reduces turnover, and provides companies with a dependable and stable workforce. 3. Enhancing Human Adaptability: While automation is transforming manufacturing, many roles still require human adaptability, problem-solving, and precision‚Äîskills that EB-3 workers bring to the table. 4. Driving Economic Growth: By filling critical labor gaps, EB-3 workers contribute to the expansion and sustainability of the manufacturing sector, driving broader economic growth and competitiveness. Amid ongoing domestic labor shortages, EB-3 workers are not just a temporary fix but a cornerstone of building a resilient, future-ready workforce for U.S. manufacturing. Connect with CN Global today to explore how we can help you thrive in this evolving labor market.

name: Dylan J. Hartmann
position: Founder @ AcudocX | PIC Finalist 2024 | Translating Futures ‚Äì together [Automated AI-assisted Certified Translation Workflow with Integrated Community]
text: Building AcudocX has been a journey of discovering the true impact of storytelling. We‚Äôre not just another translation service or tech platform‚Äîwe‚Äôre pioneering something entirely unique. By redefining the certified translation process, we‚Äôre addressing challenges others overlook and creating a space where technology meets and is enhanced by human connection.  AcudocX isn‚Äôt just a tool for certified translations. It‚Äôs a platform that empowers migrants, translators, and businesses to thrive in a globalised world. By integrating technology with cultural sensitivity and human expertise, we‚Äôre transforming what‚Äôs possible in certified translations and beyond. This is about more than language; it‚Äôs about empowerment, dignity, inclusivity, and creating opportunity.  Our vision is big, and with that comes challenges. Not everyone will immediately see the value in democratising translation workflows or how this creates a win-win for clients and translators alike. And that‚Äôs okay. Disruption is often misunderstood at first.  But we know what AcudocX represents. It‚Äôs not just a platform‚Äîit‚Äôs a movement to break down barriers, foster connection, and reimagine how translation services can impact lives and industries. From enabling faster visa applications to helping translators build better businesses, the ripple effects of this innovation are immense.  Being the founder means holding the torch for this vision. It means telling the story again and again (comment below if you have heard my mining translation story from the Coup d'√©tat!), bridging the gap between today‚Äôs understanding and tomorrow‚Äôs possibilities. Disruption isn‚Äôt just about technology‚Äîit‚Äôs about conviction, clarity, and staying true to your mission when others are still catching up.  AcudocX is here for those who believe in building a more connected, inclusive world. And I won‚Äôt compromise on that vision. It's about giving translators a tool to not only survive but thrive and compete in a ruthless industry.

position: HR| Operations Management | Hiring for US Travel Sales
text: Job Title: US Travel Sales Consultant  Location: Mohan Estate, South Delhi  Job Type: Full-time Shift: US shift (Rotational)  Job Description: We are seeking a dynamic and customer-oriented Us Travel Sales Consultant to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have 1 to 2 years of experience in the travel industry and a strong passion for helping clients plan and book their ideal trips. The Travel Consultant will be responsible for assisting customers with travel arrangements, providing expert advice on destinations, recommending travel packages, and ensuring a seamless travel experience from start to finish.  Key Responsibilities: ‚Ä¢ Client Consultation: Understand customer preferences, needs, and budget to recommend tailored travel itineraries, tours, and packages. ‚Ä¢ Booking and Reservations: Handle flight, hotel, car rental, and other travel-related bookings for clients. ‚Ä¢ Travel Advisory: Provide up-to-date information on destinations, local culture, weather, activities, and travel documentation (e.g., visas, vaccinations). ‚Ä¢ Sales: Promote and upsell travel products, services, and packages to meet sales targets and ensure customer satisfaction. ‚Ä¢ Documentation and Record-Keeping: Ensure accurate data entry, reservation records, and travel documentation. ‚Ä¢ Market Research: Stay informed about the latest travel trends, destinations, and promotions to provide informed advice to customers. ‚Ä¢ Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with customers   Requirements: ‚Ä¢ Experience: 1‚Äì2 years of experience in the travel industry, preferably in a customerfacing role such as a Travel Consultant, Travel Agent, or similar position. ‚Ä¢ Skills: o Strong communication skills (written and verbal). o Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities. o Proficiency in MS Office and travel booking software (e.g., Amadeus, Sabre, or other GDS systems is a plus). o Basic knowledge of travel industry trends and popular destinations.  ‚Ä¢ Attention to Detail: Ability to handle complex travel arrangements while ensuring accuracy. ‚Ä¢ Problem-Solving: Quick thinking and problem-solving skills to address any issues that may arise during the booking process or the trip itself. ‚Ä¢ PPC campaign Call Handling Experience required.  Benefits: ‚Ä¢ Competitive salary and lucrative incentives. ‚Ä¢ Opportunities for professional development and training. ‚Ä¢ Free meals ‚Ä¢ Cab services ‚Ä¢ Loyalty Bonus ‚Ä¢ Monthly outing/party  To apply contact on 9205699487 or share your resume on

name: Chirag Dudani
position: Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister | ex-BCG | YIF | SSCBS
text: My article in Hindustan Times co-authored with Sanjeev Sanyal.  For decades, India has been obsessively focused, on securing commitments for work visas in its trade negotiations, particularly when negotiating Free Trade Agreements (FTAs). This focus on work visas (referred to as Mode 4 in trade discussions) has frequently caused delays and in reaching agreements and forced India to yield substantial concessions in other areas. This fixation is outdated and potentially detrimental to economic interests. The demographic decline in developed economies already drives visa allocation without FTA commitments, as evidenced by a surge in US H-1B and German work visas. Post-pandemic digital service delivery (Mode 1) now constitutes 54% of total services exports, obviating physical presence requirements. Indian IT majors have reduced H-1B usage by 56%, while Western tech giants increased utilization substantially, becoming the primary beneficiaries of the visa program. The current strategy of prioritizing work visa commitments in FTAs essentially involves Indian negotiators advocating on behalf of Western multinationals, at the cost of significant concessions for India‚Äôs own economy. The article advocates abandoning visa negotiations in favor of pursuing concessions in goods, services, and investment frameworks, suggesting a 'Mode 5' approach for multi-modal delivery.

name: Alan Beck
text: I filed a new lawsuit with my co-counsel Kevin O'Grady. Hawaii maintains a complete ban on individuals owning firearms who live here pursuant to the Compact of Free Association (COFA) we have with various island nations. COFA allows people from those countries Micronesia, Palau and the Marshall Islands to enter the U.S. without a visa and live here as long as they want and we are allowed to do the same in their countries. Hawaii used to have a complete ban on noncitizens owning firearms. I filed a couple lawsuits which changed that. First for green card holders and then for U.S. Nationals. I had to do some follow up lawsuits for carry and against the counties to. After those lawsuits and the associated injunctions, Hawaii changed its laws to allows green card holders and U.S. Nationals to own guns. However, COFA aliens still can not own firearms because they are not legally permanent residents i.e. green card holders despite many living here on a permanent basis. My client has lived here for over 20 years and is completely law abiding. In his lawsuit we are alleging that Hawaii law violates his rights under the Second Amendment and under the Equal Protection Clause of the 14th Amendment. Linked to below is a copy of the complaint.

name: Ma Jun
position: Chairman of HKGFA | President of IFS | Chairman of CASI
text: Yesterday, I attended the ASEAN-China Forum 2024 hosted by the Centre on Contemporary China and the World of the University of Hong Kong. The first panel discussion, moderated by Professor Shi Han and featuring expertsandand myself, centered on identifying sustainable pathways for sustainable energy and development within the ASEAN region.  During the discussion, I highlighted the importance of a holistic approach, integrating policy, technology, and finance to advance sustainable development. On financing green transition, I discussed the interlinkage among key elements such as taxonomy, disclosure requirements, innovative financial products, as well as incentives offered by concessional interest rates, blended finance instruments, and voluntary carbon markets.  The panel also explored the critical role of capacity building in ASEAN and other emerging markets, where there is a pressing demand for transitioning to renewable energy sources. A major challenge was the scarcity of bankable green projects that can attract sufficient investment, underscoring the need for technical capacity to originate sustainable and profitable projects. Platforms such as theprovide the needed learning programs for bridging knowledge and skills gaps to develop local green finance markets and generate viable green projects.  Additionally, the panelists noted that China could be not only a supplier of low-cost green goods such as renewable equipment and EVs to ASEAN but also be an important source of demand for supporting ASEAN development. For example, I shared my view on the potential for Timor-Leste to attract a million Chinese tourists by adding direct flights, adjusting visa policies, and negotiating a tourism collaboration scheme with China.  In terms of regional collaboration, I gave two examples of how to develop win-win solutions between China and ASEAN. One is the potential for Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership ( ) to consider adding a ‚Äúgreen trade policy‚Äù element (by reducing tariff and non-tariff barriers on a list green goods) to enable faster decarbonization in the region and boost economic activities and employment in all member countries. The second example is the evolution from the Common Ground Taxonomy ( ) to the Multi-Jurisdiction Common Ground Taxonomy ( ), an initiative now jointly hosted by China, EU and Singapore that could facilitate green capital flows among China, EU, and ASEAN.  Speakers at the forum also highlighted Hong Kong's strategic position as a connector and facilitator for regional cooperation in areas such as trade, finance, advisory services, as well as development of regional standards.

name: nadeem shaikh
text: TURKEY VISA Processing kindly contact as +91 8369563657  To visit Turkey, you may need a visa, depending on your nationality and the purpose of your travel. Here's a general overview of the types of visas, the process, and requirements for obtaining a Turkish visa: 1. Types of Turkish Visas: Tourist Visa: For travelers visiting Turkey for tourism purposes. Business Visa: For people visiting for business meetings, conferences, or other professional activities. Student Visa: For those traveling to Turkey to study at a Turkish educational institution. Transit Visa: For travelers passing through Turkey to another country, for a short stopover. Work Visa: For those planning to work in Turkey. Family Visa: For family reunification or visiting family members in Turkey. 2. Visa Requirements: The general visa requirements for a Turkish visa may include: Passport: Must be valid for at least 6 months beyond the date of your planned entry to Turkey. Application Form: Complete the visa application form online or at the Turkish consulate/embassy. Photographs: Usually 1-2 passport-sized photographs. Proof of Accommodation: Hotel reservations, invitation letter, or accommodation arrangements. Travel Itinerary: Flight bookings or travel itinerary. Travel Insurance: Medical insurance valid for your stay in Turkey (for longer stays or certain visa types). Financial Proof: Evidence of sufficient funds to cover your stay (bank statements, pay slips). Visa Fee: Payment of the visa fee, which can vary based on nationality, type, and duration of stay. 3. E-Visa (Electronic Visa): Many nationalities can apply for an e-Visa for short visits (tourism, business, or transit). The e-Visa is an online visa that is quicker and easier to obtain than a traditional visa. Eligibility: Citizens of countries eligible for the e-Visa can apply via the official Turkish government e-Visa portal. Process: The process is entirely online. After filling out an online form, you can pay the visa fee and receive the e-Visa via email. Validity: The e-Visa is typically valid for up to 90 days within a 180-day period. 4. Visa on Arrival: Turkey offers Visa on Arrival for nationals of some countries. This allows you to obtain a visa when you arrive in Turkey, although the eligibility depends on your nationality. However, it's generally recommended to apply for an e-Visa or traditional visa beforehand to avoid potential delays. 5. How to Apply for a Turkish Visa: Online (E-Visa): If eligible, you can apply via the Turkish government's official e-Visa website:. Consulate/Embassy: If you are not eligible for an e-Visa, you will need to apply at a Turkish consulate or embassy in your home country. The procedure may require an appointment, submission of documents, and an in-person interview.

name: Binur Zhalenov
position: Chief Digital Officer of the National Bank of Kazakhstan üá∞üáø
text: Kazakhstan: A Digital Pioneer in the Making üåç  Almost a year ago, during a conversation with my esteemed colleagues and friendsand, we reflected on how Kazakhstan‚Äôs remarkable progress in developing digital infrastructure was underappreciated globally.  Fast forward to today, it‚Äôs great that thehas published a comprehensive report, ‚ÄúBuilding Digital Public Infrastructure: Lessons Learned from Kazakhstan‚Äù authored by.  This insightful analysis highlights key takeaways from our journey and underlines Kazakhstan‚Äôs role as a trailblazer in digital public infrastructure.  üîë Key lessons from the report: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Visionary leadership is essential: Kazakhstan‚Äôs focus on long-term goals like the Digital Tenge, Open Banking, and Faster Payments showcases the importance of strategic vision. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Collaboration drives progress: Partnerships between public institutions, private players, and international stakeholders have been pivotal to success. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Inclusive digital ecosystems matter: Ensuring accessibility and interoperability has been a cornerstone in building infrastructure that benefits all citizens. 4Ô∏è‚É£ A proactive regulatory approach: Balancing innovation with consumer protection has set a strong foundation for trust in digital financial services.  A big thank you toandfor shining a light on Kazakhstan‚Äôs achievements and for facilitating this important dialogue.  I encourage everyone to read this thought-provoking report.  Let‚Äôs continue the conversation on how countries can learn from each other to build inclusive and innovative digital economies!

name: Tourism Plus Shanghai
position: Shanghai Sinoexpo Informa Markets International Exhibition Co., Ltd. - Tourism Plus Shanghai 2025
text: Direct flights between China and India, suspended for more than four years, may soon resume. The two countries‚Äô foreign ministers recently discussed the restoration of direct air services and visa facilitation during a meeting in Rio de Janeiro. This move comes after the pandemic and bilateral tensions disrupted previously operating routes, such as Air India's routes to Guangzhou and Shanghai flights, and IndiGo's Chengdu service. Travelers currently face longer transit times via Hong Kong, Dubai or Singapore. If the direct flights resume, it will mark a significant milestone in Sino-Indian relations, especially as 2025 approaches‚Äîthe 75th anniversary of their diplomatic ties.

name: CC Professor Jason Green, BA, MLIS
text: I haven‚Äôt been on LinkedIn in a very long while. I checked my inbox and there are a suspicious number of ‚ÄúAngel Investment‚Äù DM‚Äôs asking for lower sums of money in trade for services. Has LinkedIn become the new Facebook MLM? It‚Äôs odd that these accounts a very new and asking for a Google Document to be filled out and then a wire transfer to be sent. So, these people soliciting money would like for me to give them money, I provide the service, and then the ‚Äústartup‚Äù provides me with an ROI for what? I know they are scams, but, if they want to scam me, then I‚Äôll play along. I‚Äôve asked them all for $50,000 upfront for my services and then after 6 months I‚Äôll make an investment of the $25K first. I‚Äôve had several people respond quickly saying ‚ÄúIf you make the investment now, then we will pay you the $50,000 after a six month period.‚Äù I‚Äôve declined and said ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I need to be paid upfront or I‚Äôll take ownership of the‚Äùstartup‚Äù (legally) at 25%.‚Äù They‚Äôve mostly all responded by saying ‚ÄúOur company can give you $50,000 after you wire at least $12,500.00 first.‚Äù Wait, I thought the ‚ÄúAngel Investment‚Äù was $25K, now it‚Äôs half off? Is that because of ‚ÄúBlack Friday?‚Äù üòÇ Scammers will stop at nothing, will they? I certainly hope no one is actually falling for these things. I had one gentleman say that in order to prove his ‚Äústartup‚Äù was real,if I Venmo‚Äôed him $10,000.00 as a good faith investment he would immediately Venmo wire transfer me $50,000.00 to prove it was real. So I send you money, you  send me 80% back to prove it‚Äôs a real start up. What kind of craziness is this?Just send me the  $40,000.00 now and let‚Äôs see how ‚Äúreal‚Äù this ‚Äúreal start up‚Äù is. After I agree to send the $10,000, the gentleman said ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a man of his word‚Äù and send me $40,000.00. But for what? They haven‚Äôt even explained the business or its concept, just that money gets transferred to them, but to not send it to the ‚ÄúOfficial Startup Account,‚Äù but to a Gmail address because it‚Äôs easier for tax purposes. Which non of it makes sense. So I agreed to all of this and then I was asked to get the largest amount of of Visa prepaid cards and send them the numbers so they could transfer money back to me afterwards. I declined and then they started getting belligerent and saying ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre trying to scam our ‚Äústartup.‚Äù How is that possible when I have no idea what the start up is and now you want prepaid Visa card? üòÇ You know someone is falling for this somewhere. Someone has given these people money or else they wouldn‚Äôt keep doing it. We went from legitimate bank transfers to pre-paid Visa cards. There is a sucker horn every minute. Just for the fun of it, I started giving one scammers info to another scammer just to see what would happen. Haven‚Äôt heard back from anyone yet after that. Please beware of the scammers. They will take any amount of money as they seem very desperate.

name: Pradeep Anthony
position: "Business-Driven HR Leader | Transforming Talent Strategies for Growth | Digital Transformation & Leadership Hiring Expert"
text: Why Giving First Leads to True Happiness: A thanksgiving lesson from a Village College  During my trip to India in September, I visited St. Charles College of Arts and Sciences in Eraiyur village, Tamil Nadu, to join the students and faculty in celebrating their convocation ceremony. This small village, home to 2000 families, is surrounded by over 75 smaller hamlets, all served by this humble yet impactful college. Witnessing the graduation of the second batch of students was a deeply moving experience.  Unlike the grand convocations I‚Äôve attended in the past, this ceremony was striking in its simplicity. No elaborate stages or grand gestures‚Äîjust pure, heartfelt moments. Yet, it left an indelible mark on me, reminding me that true impact doesn‚Äôt need pomp or show.  As we recently celebrated Thanksgiving, this experience took on even greater meaning. Thanksgiving is a time to reflect on the blessings in our lives and the importance of giving back. The convocation at St. Charles reminded me of the transformative power of education and the role of values, integrity, strength, and ambition in building a brighter future‚Äînot just for oneself, but for others as well.  In speaking to the students, I shared what I believe to be a guiding framework for personal and professional success, which I called their VISA for life.  ‚Ä¢ V ‚Äì Values: Stay grounded in your values, which will guide you in making the right decisions. ‚Ä¢ I ‚Äì Integrity: Always act with integrity, for it earns trust and respect. ‚Ä¢ S ‚Äì Strength: Draw on your inner strength to overcome challenges, as the road to success is never easy. ‚Ä¢ A ‚Äì Ambition: Let your ambition fuel your drive to achieve and make an impact.  This framework isn‚Äôt just for students; it‚Äôs equally relevant for those of us navigating the corporate world. Our values define us, integrity builds trust, strength helps us persevere, and ambition drives innovation and growth.  As I reflect on this experience and the spirit of Thanksgiving, I am reminded that happiness is not in receiving but in giving first. One need not be at the forefront to create an impact; often, greater impact can be created by leading from the side. Whether it‚Äôs institutions like St. Charles College or the thousands of others quietly working to transform lives, they remind us of the immense power of giving. Supporting such institutions‚Äîthrough time, effort, or resources‚Äînot only empowers students and uplifts communities but also ensures that the cycle of opportunity continues for generations to come.  When we embrace this spirit of giving first‚Äîboth in life and at work‚Äîwe lay the foundation for lasting impact and true fulfillment.

name: Elvira Matz
text: I april 2023 spelade jag in en film tillsammans med Niklas Ulfvebrand, Axel Kjellin , Micke och Annika nere p√• 155 meters djup i Sala Silvergruva . Det resulterade i pitchen som vi skickade in till Warner Bros Sverige som producerar Luciamorgon √•t SVT. Jag var redan d√• helt √∂vertygad om att vi skulle f√• programmet till Sala och vi gjorde allt vi kunde f√∂r att de skulle tycka samma sak üòä Producenten Eva och regiss√∂renkom hit i januari och tillsammans medfick jag och Niklas visa upp ett sn√∂t√§ckt Sala - allt fr√•n V√§sby Kungsg√•rd och Sockenkyrkan till Stadsparken, Kristina kyrka och S√§tra Brunn. De landade i ett ja till Sala och inspelningen b√∂rjade planeras i smyg. Under resans g√•ng fick vi skicka in f√∂rslag p√• musiker, k√∂rer, s√•ngare med mera och n√§r jag och Niklas fick fr√•gan i oktober om vi ville medverka i programmet skakade jag i ett dygn. S√• chockad, stolt och nerv√∂s blev jag. Att sjunga √§r det b√§sta jag vet, det √§r den plats d√§r jag √§r som mest n√§rvarande och att f√• g√∂ra det i det h√§r forumet √§r bortom mina dr√∂mmar. Att dessutom f√• g√∂ra det p√• en plats jag tycker mycket om och med Niklas, som under jubileumsresan har blivit en n√§ra v√§n, har skapat ett minne f√∂r livet. Jag hoppas att vi kan sprida ljus i m√∂rkret och att v√•r s√•ng ska fylla er stund med n√§rvaro. V√§lkommen att titta och lyssna den 13 december p√• SVT play eller p√• kv√§llskonserten i Kristina kyrka kl. 21.00. ‚ù§  Foto:

text: Exciting News: Expansion of the H-2B Visa Program for FY 2025!  I'm thrilled to share that the United States is expanding its H-2B visa program, offering 64,716 additional visas for the fiscal year 2025. This expansion is a significant stride towards addressing labor shortages in essential non-agricultural sectors such as hospitality, construction, and landscaping.  Key Highlights:- - Increased Workforce: The addition of new visas will support businesses struggling to fill seasonal roles, helping them meet demand while boosting economic growth. - Diverse Opportunities: This move opens up diverse opportunities for foreign workers looking to contribute their skills to the U.S. economy. - Economic Impact: By boosting the workforce, industries that rely on seasonal labor can maintain operations and continue to thrive.  This expansion reflects a balanced approach to immigration, addressing the needs of the economy while providing new opportunities for foreign workers. As we navigate these changes, it‚Äôs crucial for businesses and HR professionals to stay informed and ensure compliance with visa regulations.  Let's embrace this opportunity to strengthen our workforce and drive innovation across industries. What are your thoughts on this development? How will it impact your sector?    -
