flota m√°s grande de aviones Airbus A380. Adem√°s, opera en 133 ciudades de 74 pa√≠ses de todos los continentes. En promedio, Emirates pauta un aproximado de 3.400 vuelos semanales que se comandan desde su base en Dubai.  Entre los beneficios de unirse a la aerol√≠nea se encuentran la posibilidad de crecer en la carrera profesional en una empresa certificada, conocer nuevos destinos y contar con un ingreso salarial libre de impuestos. Requisitos para trabajar con Emirates Airline La empresa √°rabe abri√≥ la convocatoria para contratar a un tripulante de cabina. El reclutamiento ser√° el 21 de diciembre a las 9 en Buenos Aires y los interesados deber√°n enviar su curr√≠culum ao aplicar desde la p√°gina oficial:.  Los requisitos son:  - Fluidez en ingl√©s escrito y hablado (si tambi√©n se sabe hablar otros idiomas mejor)  - Saber trabajar en equipo y tener una personalidad que destaque  - Al menos 160 cm de altura y capaz de alcanzar 212 cm de altura  - Capaz de cumplir con los requisitos de visa de trabajo de los Emiratos √Årabes Unidos  - Tener al menos 21 a√±os de edad  - Tener al menos 1 a√±o de experiencia en hospitalidad o servicio al cliente  - Tener un m√≠nimo de educaci√≥n secundaria  - No tener tatuajes que puedan ser visibles con el uniforme de la tripulaci√≥n de cabina de Emirates  A la convocatoria que se realizar√° en la Ciudad de Buenos Aires no podr√° asistir cualquier aplicante. Una vez enviado el curr√≠culum, la empresa responder√° con una invitaci√≥n por el mismo medio acercando la invitaci√≥n para la siguiente instancia a los seleccionados.

name: Yukiya Usami
position: MSc in Financial Modelling & Investment at Glasgow | East-West Investments, Pinpoint Asset Management, Wells Fargo, Bloomberg
text: My post yesterday has been incredibly viral, more than 30000 impression... I couldn't believe it still now. Let me explain some things in more detail.  Firstly, surely, I couldn't reach out to the dream jobs of Macro Trader/Researcher, Quantitative Trader/Researcher, Portfolio Analyst/Associate, Investment analyst/associate for Multi-Asset. However, If you are open to expand the range of vacancies in terms of Location, Job Content and so forth (ex. out of London, or operational roles), it will be much easier to get a job in the financial institution in terms of competitiveness and eligibility.(Still I was rejected at more than 99% operational roles applications...when it comes to front office job hunting, 99.99% of my job applications were rejected lol)  However, I didn't make much of expanding the range of acceptable vacancies because they will not lead me to my career goal of Macro(Multi-Asset) Portfolio Manager/Fund Manager/Strategist in UK Asset Management Company/Hedge Fund in the future. Thus, I decided to add related working experience in Japan, which I think will be more advantageous for my final career goal.  Secondly, when it comes to the reason why I couldn't get the job, I found 2 main factors at the current point. The first is the shortage of my educational background. If you want to go to the front office in the investment bank or asset management company (hedge fund etc...) in the UK, it's better to have Master's degree at University of Cambridge, Oxford, Imperial, LSE, LBS, UCL and so on. Especially, if you want to get quantitative roles or trader roles, you should have STEM degree in top universities. Secondly, my ability and experience is short at all in terms of experienced hiring and graduate scheme. I didn't have permanent front office experience, and the middle office experience was only a year. It was completely next to nothing. When it comes to Graduate Scheme, I couldn't pass the online assessment of numerical/logical reasoning in English. There are some VISA regulations, but I know some people who is really smart and get the graduate level hedge fund jobs/investment banking jobs from top universities. Thus, VISA regulation isn't the complete factor which prevent you from being inaugurated.  This terrible result is completely owing to my lack of ability. That's it. So if you are confident and smart, it will be worth trying!  Last but not least, I subscribed some support business such as automated writing resume according to AI Screening, or the networking and connection service, or some internship with much fee. It didn't give me good result, at least in my case, so I wouldn't recommend.(Maybe is it only me or?)  Anyway, Thank you for seeing my post. I maybe retry in the future with much more experience!  Kind Regards, Yukiya

name: Service and Creative Skills Australia (SaCSA)
text: On 3 December 2024, the Australian Government announced the release of the Core Skills Occupation List (CSOL). SaCSA welcomes the inclusion of these occupations.  The CSOL is informed by labour market analysis and stakeholder consultations by(JSA). It will shape migration settings, specifically the new Core Skills stream of the new Skills in Demand visa, from 7 December 2024. The CSOL will also apply to the Direct Entry stream of the permanent Employer Nomination Scheme visa.  Why Being on the List Matters:  Inclusion on the CSOL allows employers to access Australia‚Äôs skilled migration pathways to address workforce shortages. It ensures businesses can sponsor skilled workers for critical roles, supports workforce stability, and aligns migration policy with industry needs. These targeted solutions can help address workforce and skills needs.  SaCSA‚Äôs Role in Contributing to the CSOL:  SaCSA conducted an in-depth analysis and gathered industry stakeholder feedback to ensure that occupations across our sectors were represented in the CSOL. This included SaCSA‚Äôs input to JSA for the 2024 Occupation Shortage List (OSL) which informs CSOL, as well as surveys and submissions for the draft CSOL itself.  Thank you to all stakeholders who engaged with us in this process. To learn more, or read the list in full, visit:

text: üåç‚ú® Abrodify at GCEC Commerce clave X 2024! ‚ú®üåç  We were thrilled to participate as an exhibitor at the GCEC Commerce clave X 2024, held on 4th December 2024 at the Rajasthan International Center, Jhalana, Jaipur. It was an incredible opportunity to connect with ambitious students from undergraduate programs as well as 11th and 12th graders, guiding them on their journey to explore global education and career opportunities.  At our stall, we engaged with students and parents, providing valuable insights on: üéì Study Abroad Opportunities ‚Äì Top countries and universities for commerce and related fields. üí∏ Cost Planning ‚Äì A breakdown of tuition fees, scholarships, and living expenses. üìù Preparation Guidance ‚Äì Assistance with language tests (IELTS/PTE), application processes, and profile building. ‚úàÔ∏è Visa and Post-Study Work Options ‚Äì Steps to secure a visa and explore work opportunities abroad after graduation.  The enthusiasm and curiosity of the students were truly inspiring, and we were glad to answer their questions and help them take the first step toward achieving their dreams of studying and working abroad.  A big thank you to the GCEC team for organizing this fantastic conclave and giving us a platform to connect with bright, young minds. Together, let‚Äôs continue building a future full of global opportunities!

name: Pacific Australia Labour Mobility (PALM) scheme
text: The Department of Home Affairs recently cancelled the visa of a foreign national who was operating as an unlawful provider of immigration assistance while in Australia.  This person had charged more than 1,000 visa applicants a lot of money for immigration advice, telling them to apply for a Protection visa despite knowing they were not eligible and would be refused.  This was not only illegal; it also caused unnecessary delays to the applications of asylum seekers and others who genuinely need Australia‚Äôs protection.  Under Australian law, only registered migration agents and Australian legal practitioners can charge a fee for providing immigration assistance.

text: ùêÅùêûùêßùêûùêüùê¢ùê≠ùê¨ ùê®ùêü ùêèùêéùêëùêìùêîùêÜùêÄùêã ùêíùêìùêÄùêëùêìùêîùêè ùêïùêàùêíùêÄ ùêèùêëùêéùêÜùêëùêÄùêå üáµüáπ  ‚úÖùêÄùêúùêúùêûùê¨ùê¨ ùê≠ùê® ùêèùê®ùê´ùê≠ùêÆùê†ùêöùê• ùê´ùêûùê¨ùê¢ùêùùêûùêßùêúùêû ùêöùê≠ ùêö ùêãùê®ùê∞ ùêÇùê®ùê¨ùê≠ To obtain a Startup Visa, you must confirm that you have at least ‚Ç¨9,840, which is the minimum funds for a year of stay in Portugal. The visa does not require any investment with a fixed cost.  ‚úÖùêïùê¢ùê¨ùêö-ùêüùê´ùêûùêû ùê≠ùê´ùêöùêØùêûùê• ùê¢ùêß ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùêíùêúùê°ùêûùêßùê†ùêûùêß ùêÄùê´ùêûùêö With Portugal residency permit you are allowed to spend 90 days out of 180 in other Schengen countries without a visa.  ‚úÖùêíùê≠ùêöùê´ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêö ùêÅùêÆùê¨ùê¢ùêßùêûùê¨ùê¨ ùê¢ùêß ùêèùê®ùê´ùê≠ùêÆùê†ùêöùê• To obtain a Portugal Startup Visa, you must establish a startup in partnership with a top Portuguese business incubator. The incubator can make working in a foreign country easier, such as by assisting with paperwork or providing a low-cost office space.  ‚úÖùêÄùê©ùê©ùê•ùê≤ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêúùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùê≥ùêûùêßùê¨ùê°ùê¢ùê© ùêöùêüùê≠ùêûùê´ ùüì ùê≤ùêûùêöùê´ùê¨ After living in Portugal for five years, you can seek for citizenship. Doing business there could improve your chances of approval.  ‚úÖùêìùêöùê± ùêéùê©ùê≠ùê¢ùê¶ùê¢ùê¨ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß Startup owners that live in Portugal for 183 days per year become tax residents and may be eligible for a 10-year beneficial tax status known as Non-habitual Resident.  ùêãùêûùêöùê´ùêß ùêåùê®ùê´ùêû:  üèÜ ùêçùêöùê¶ùêûùêù ùêöùê¶ùê®ùêßùê† ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê≠ùê®ùê© ùüêùüì ùê¢ùê¶ùê¶ùê¢ùê†ùê´ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê•ùêöùê∞ùê≤ùêûùê´ùê¨ ùê¢ùêß ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê•ùêù üèÜ ùüêùüé+ ùê≤ùêûùêöùê´ùê¨ ùê®ùêü ùêûùê±ùê©ùêûùê´ùê¢ùêûùêßùêúùêû ùê¢ùêß ùêÇùêöùêßùêöùêùùê¢ùêöùêß ùêàùê¶ùê¶ùê¢ùê†ùê´ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêãùêöùê∞ùê¨ üèÜ ùêíùêÆùêúùêúùêûùê¨ùê¨ùêüùêÆùê•ùê•ùê≤ ùê´ùêûùê•ùê®ùêúùêöùê≠ùêûùêù ùêßùêûùêöùê´ùê•ùê≤ ùüì,ùüéùüéùüé ùêüùêöùê¶ùê¢ùê•ùê¢ùêûùê¨ ùêöùêßùêù ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêüùêûùê¨ùê¨ùê¢ùê®ùêßùê¨ ùê≠ùê® ùêÇùêöùêßùêöùêùùêö üì≤ ùêñùêûùêúùê°ùêöùê≠: üì≤ ùêìùêûùê•ùêûùê©ùê°ùê®ùêßùêû: +852 9457 9149 üìû ùêñùê°ùêöùê≠ùê¨ùêÄùê©ùê©: üåê ùêñùêûùêõùê¨ùê¢ùê≠ùêû: --------------------------------------- üáµüáπ

name: Arnela Tolic
position: Lawyer (Immigration/Employment Law)| Accredited NMAS Mediator| CPD Lecturer| Business Coach üë©‚Äçüè´
text: Skills in Demand (SID) Visa Launches: A Game-Changer for Migrants and Employers  On 7 December 2024, Australia introduces the Skills in Demand (SID) Visa, a significant step toward addressing workforce shortages and attracting global talent to priority industries.  Central to this initiative is the new Core Skills Occupation List (CSOL), which replaces the outdated Skilled Occupation List (SOL) with a focused approach to economic growth.  What is the CSOL? The CSOL targets high-demand roles crucial for Australia‚Äôs economy, based on up-to-date labour market analysis and industry consultation.  New Occupations: Key Highlights Technology and Cybersecurity Cyber Security Engineer DevOps Engineer Data Scientist Agriculture and Aquaculture Aquaculture Scientist Animal Husbandry Technician Skilled Trades & Emerging Roles Furniture Maker Content Creator Regulatory Affairs Manager  These updates reflect Australia‚Äôs push for talent in cutting-edge fields and essential services.  OSCA: A New Classification System The Occupation Standard Classification for Australia (OSCA) replaces ANZSCO, refining specialisations like:  Agronomist (formerly Agricultural Scientist). Respiratory Technician (previously Medical Technicians NEC).  Exclusions and Transition Deadlines Some roles, including Caf√© Manager, Copywriter, and Chiropractor, are excluded. Employers must finalise nominations for these by the transition deadline.  Benefits of the SID Visa For Employers Streamlined access to global talent in critical roles. A more focused occupation list to address workforce needs.  For Migrants Lower eligibility thresholds (1 year of experience). Clear pathways in high-demand industries.  Key Legal Considerations Sponsorship Obligations Align roles with the CSOL.  Provide competitive salaries and demonstrate local recruitment efforts. Visa Conditions for Migrants  Work in the approved occupation and maintain compliance records. Transition from SOL to CSOL  Review and adjust pending applications to meet the new standards. OSCA Adjustments  Consult migration professionals for alignment under the new framework.  Get Expert Assistance The SID visa is a bold step forward, but navigating its complexities requires professional guidance. Contact Tolic Lawyers for expert advice on how employers and migrants can maximise this opportunity.  Let‚Äôs build Australia‚Äôs future together. More to be published tomorrow- WATCH this space.

text: üö® We‚Äôre Hiring! Site Supervisor - Dubboüö®  Location: Dubbo, NSW Type: Full time  We are seeking a seasoned Civil Site Supervisor with at least 8 years of experience in civil infrastructure projects to join our esteemed client‚Äôs team in Dubbo. This role is ideal for a professional with proven expertise in managing large-scale civil projects and a commitment to excellence in project delivery. Local experience is highly desired.   Key Responsibilities:  ‚Ä¢ Oversee and manage all on-site activities for civil infrastructure projects, ensuring projects are completed on time, within scope, and budget. ‚Ä¢ Coordinate with project engineers, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to ensure efficient workflow and quality standards. ‚Ä¢ Monitor site safety and ensure compliance with all relevant safety regulations and standards. ‚Ä¢ Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly progress reports, ensuring accurate and timely documentation. ‚Ä¢ Resolve on-site issues promptly, with minimal disruption to the project timeline. ‚Ä¢ Ensure adherence to project plans, specifications, and environmental requirements.  Requirements:  ‚Ä¢ Minimum 8 years of experience as a Civil Site Supervisor in infrastructure projects. ‚Ä¢ Proven track record of delivering complex civil projects on time and to budget. ‚Ä¢ Excellent leadership skills, with the ability to manage and inspire on-site teams. ‚Ä¢ Exceptional problem-solving and communication skills. ‚Ä¢ Commitment to health, safety, and environmental practices.   üîπ **How to Apply:**  Apply here:  Discover our other job offers üåê  üìç **Opportunities available nationwide**  Join McD Project Services and be where your skills are seen, your work is valued, and your career can flourish!

name: Shawn Buttling
position: Co-Founder, Director @ Gig-Space | Gig-Guides, Gig-Marine, Gig-Stage (Entertainment)
text: Australians don‚Äôt want to do the work? Let‚Äôs talk about it.  If you have missed the news, top restaurants in Sydney are raising alarms over the difficulty of finding Australians to work in hospitality. The numbers don‚Äôt lie‚Äî8 out of 10 businesses are hiking pay or improving conditions to attract talent.  At Gig Space, we are no strangers to these challenges. We see the same story playing out across tourism, marine, and entertainment. While there‚Äôs no denying the pressures on migration and visa policies, I firmly believe the solution goes beyond pointing fingers. It‚Äôs about bridging the gap.  Our platform connects passionate professionals‚Äîwhether they are locals or international‚Äîwith opportunities that match their skills and aspirations. Talent isn‚Äôt about nationality; it‚Äôs about people who care, who show up, and who are ready to make an impact.  Yes, policy changes affect industries. But so does innovation, collaboration, and rethinking how we tap into untapped potential. With the right tools and mindset, we can ensure industries like hospitality (and beyond) thrive, regardless of the barriers in place.  If you are a business struggling to find the right talent or a professional seeking your next gig, we are here to help!

name: Shubham Chakraborty
position: Writer for hire | Blogs, Articles, Whitepapers, Social Media | ex-MMT, ToI, GAIL | XLRI, NIT Bhopal
text: India's most searched travel destinations in 2024 (Google search) puts Azerbaijan at #1.  Surpriaingly, there's no European destination in the list. It's a welcome development.  With Schengen visa's super high rejection rates, it's about time we look for other destinatikns to spend our money.  From the past few year's Indian tourists have flocked to Central Asian countries like Kazakhstan, Georgia, Uzbekistan, etc.  I went to Georgia this year, beautiful country, warm hospitality, and a good outlook towards Indians (no racism) ensured we had a really good experience.  If you need a 10-day Georgia itinerary that I made for the trip, feel free to DM me.

name: Himmat Anand
text: Google is the undisputed Bible of Search. Below is their list of Top Trending Searches for Travel - India. And a few things stand out as I go through this list.  * Outbound Travel is on a given high. Five of the ten top destinations are international. A growth of some 18% year on year in this segment will be no surprise. *All these international destinations are now offering direct and reasonably priced flights. With Indian aviation growing, direct flight to global points is bound to increase and be the draw for travel. *These destinations are also offering visa on arrival - a huge plus, given the cumbersome visa process of Europe and the US. Another trend indicator.  On the other hand, the domestic destinations did surprise me a bit. Manali, South Goa, Ayodhya may be on the list of 'most searched' but are definitely not on the list of 'most visited'. Hence just searches don't really translate into business, just as Likes on a Post doesn't mean conversions.

name: Nomos
text: The Family Violence provisions in Division 1.5 of the Migration Regulations 1994 (Cth) will apply to the below visas from 17 December 2024:  - Parent (subclass 103); - Remaining Relative (subclasses 115 and 835); - Carer (subclasses 116 and 836); - Business Talent (subclass 132); - Contributory Parent (subclass 143); - Pacific Engagement (subclass 192); - Aged Parent (subclass 804); - Contributory Aged Parent (subclass 864); and - Business Innovation and Investment (subclass 888).  The government has repeatedly stated its position that a secondary applicant should not feel compelled to stay in a violent relationship for a visa outcome, and it appears that they intend to follow through with the expansion of these provisions to more visas in the program.

text: Exciting Updates for ENS 186 Visa!   From 7 December 2024, new changes make it easier for skilled workers to secure permanent residency!  Key Updates: Count all sponsored work (including promotions) for the 2-year TRT requirement. New Core Skills Income Threshold (AUD 73,150+). Age exemptions remain for medical practitioners and high-income earners. Direct Entry now includes the modernised Core Skills Occupation List (CSOL) covering Construction, Cybersecurity, Health, and more! Start your journey to permanent residency now!
